It is a fun and unique game that I didn't expect to like. The devs and community are nice and helpful with any question I've ever had in chat.

In the end, the game is free and trying it out doesn't cost anything.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063615320', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1459, 'last_played': 1521504901}
review: Fun, unique mmo, the dev is almost always in game to answer question.

author: {'steamid': '76561198795770236', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1513276563}
review:
Great game. Went beyond my expectations. I was expecting a simple, casual indie mmo but this is so much more. Add me to the pile of other people saying the community is great. It is so good it is enough reason alone to keep playing. But the good news is I love the game too.

I like combat that makes you think and plan. Stash does that in a big way. I also love player housing and the "BOO" as they call it is really blowing me away. It is almost a game all by itself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152143806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 663, 'last_played': 1513373600}
review: After first seeing this game a few months ago, I knew I wanted to play it, but I had other things concerning me at the moment. Now I can actually play it, and it's definetely good. For one thing, the graphics aren't half bad, and the gameplay in combat is pretty straight forward. Heck, the entire game is easy to learn, but it takes REAL devotion to actually master it. Truly a staple of grid combat MMO's, people should take examples from it. Kind of reminds me of Pirate 101 from Kingsisle Entertainment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198449577020', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 11384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11206, 'last_played': 1513291093}
review:
Awesome game!!!!!!!!! I love it and play it all day long now. I can't stop. 

Devs need to stop making the game so awesome so I can resume the rest of my life.

But I cant because my traps need to be checked and my barns tended to and then I need to clear just one more dungeon and then my traps are ready again and ok one more dungeon and wheeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065928889', 'num_games_owned': 486, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1531589825}
review: Nice game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198449581998', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7155, 'last_played': 1513283497}
review:
Not sure what I can add that has not already been said in so many reviews here. This is the most original and refreshing MMO I have played in many years. It is the first mmo that has captured that gaming group feeling that so many of us remember from before mmos. 

The combat is incredibly deep and rewards strategic thinking.

The housing is the best I have ever seen. 

The community is so great I don't even know how to describe it. Very friendly and also interesting and fun to game with. Some of the contests they have run lately show how imaginative the people are as well.

I could go on and on but the truth is you owe it to yourself to try this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039002707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 101696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50573, 'last_played': 1697629401}
review: Nice game, nice dev's, nice community.  Just try it out, don't be shy to ask for help. See you in the game :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198008393924', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1512313793}
review:
I like the idea of a casual, cartoonish, turn based indie MMORPG, and I hate to give this game a negative feedback; but the reality is, in it's current state the game not worth your time.

I don't want to describe all the issues, as it would be a useless multi-page review. So here's a short summary:

- There's no real content in this game. All you do is go to autogenerated dungeon (not a real dungeon btw, simply rectangular area filled with mobs, without any story/theme/objectives etc.), kill mobs one by one in an extremely repetitive turn-based combat, fill inventory, go to the only city (!) in the game and sell loot. Quest lines/story/events/exploration are basically non existent in this game.
- The game is underpopulated. On average, there are only about 10 people online minding their own business. At times it makes it feel like a single player game.
- I know this is an indie game with a very small dev team, but even so the quality is just... bad. Even if you ignore the numerous bugs the game feels more like an unfinished prototype. 
- If you dare to give your feedback or suggest some improvements to the game, the community (yes, those 10 people who play the game) gets really defensive about it. This is usually a sign that the game is not going to be getting any better.

P.S. Props to the devs for making the game work natively on linux.

author: {'steamid': '76561198448992668', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1317, 'last_played': 1512011165}
review:
Really love this game and already full on addicted. Such a charming world and tactical combat that really rewards planning and strategy. 

My BOO (your house in Stash) is already getting pretty snazzy and I predict I will spend an obscene amount of time decorating and redecorating this place. 

I find the market really fascinating as it definitely rewards people who put time into building their reputation. I already know some of the top chefs in the game and they are both a source of good food and also where I can sell many of the seeds and other things I find that they need. It is a very nice economic cycle. 

There are already hints of world story developments that I cannot wait to expand and be part of.

Thank you for making Stash!

author: {'steamid': '76561198451375924', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1653, 'last_played': 1511932099}
review:
Really incredible, original, and interesting game. Clearly made with care and passion. Successfully captures the fun and wonder of a tabletop gaming experience while combining the huge, epic feel of an MMO.

Developers are extremely involved and responsive to players. Even though it is a small team you hear from them pretty much every single day which is amazing.

The people in the community are great too, making this a really great place to hang out, kill monsters, get loot, and build up my house.

Highly recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198042659352', 'num_games_owned': 377, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 3406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2196, 'last_played': 1538349370}
review: nice. very little pay bounuses

author: {'steamid': '76561198273198668', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 6153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6153, 'last_played': 1512072031}
review: Tried to like it but there was not enough there.  Final straw was lack of support when I put in a ticket.

author: {'steamid': '76561198448784403', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 892, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 892, 'last_played': 1511832816}
review:
The game I've been looking for after many years of playing tons of MMOs. There is so much depth to its systems I know this will be my game for many years. The community is wonderful. The developers are a big part of that with their active involvement, but the other players are really a pleasant surprise. So many online games are toxic nowadays making Stash truly a fresh change.

The combat is super deep and brings back memories of wargaming on tabletop. I love it and cannot wait to see more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198368978838', 'num_games_owned': 40, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 21002, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4750, 'last_played': 1521617414}
review: Here is a game that allows the mind to wander without having to learn the intricacies of button rotation, watching the screen for stuff to get out off, and all the other hand eye of most MMOs. Instead, this is all about the mind. Like several games emerging this year or in alpha/beta - this game is about choosing your own life path. No master villain. There is a lot in this game about personalization and expression. One handed weapons for example all look different but there is no "must choose". The levels can fly by fast or as slow as you want them. But you will need to be community conscious. The wiki is very incomplete so far and there is a ton of nuance to learn. Basics are easy - but the devil is in the details and this game can be played at a very detailed level.

author: {'steamid': '76561198306091401', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3315, 'last_played': 1512478276}
review:
I'm recommending this game out of respect for the hardwork of the developers. 
Pro: 
Great community and developer team who are regularly involved with new events.
Fun turned based combat mode
Base of Operations is a player housing system unlike other games.
Not Pay to win although you can get a small advantage from the Medallion shop with real money but nothing that really makes you powerful just more convenience.
Cons:
Lack of content makes the game very repetitive and grindy after about 10-12 hours of play.
Leveling is too slow even at the low levels.
Crafting is too slow even at the low levels.
Good items are all player crafted and therefore there is little to look forward to when getting chest. This for me is the biggest letdown of the game. It can be grindy but if RNG can turn up some great powerful items, there is always a motivation to fight more. Now after every fight i dun even bother looking at what i get in the chest. You only get more powerful every 5 levels and the levels in between are just numbers to get through with no significant benefits. Please upgrade your loot system.

5/10 Good game great potential but some areas needs immediate improvement if the game wants to attract more people beyond the first few hours.

Edit: Ok I no longer recommend this game. It seems I was lucky and the period which I joined the game happened to be a brief period where they was some activity. Game has gone dead now which makes the already repetitive and grindy game feel 10x more boring. Go play something else. This game will put you to sleep after the first 3-4 hours of play

author: {'steamid': '76561197969997457', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1442, 'last_played': 1511216773}
review: Stash is a MMO that supports a great degree of customization and gameplay but doesn't suffer from the feeling that it is overcrowded metropolis.  At it's core it captures the sensation of starting a new d&d missiong, tucked away in the corner expansive land.  It is nice to run into the first set of encounters are really have an interest in the type and capacity of monsters in a turned based setting, without everything feeling like mayhem.  It is a shame so many games have often abandonded what makes for such great combat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064268541', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3414, 'last_played': 1512091906}

author: {'steamid': '76561198018231802', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1511210946}

author: {'steamid': '76561198114710051', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 5711, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3697, 'last_played': 1515835865}
review:
This is one of those game concepts which should of been obvious in hindsight. It's not sliced bread or anything or even anything particularly grand. It is simply what Free-2-Play MMOs should of evolved into at this point.

This game features:
Turn-based combat, so players can actually chat with each other while chopping apart monsters
Mechanics that encourage group play without forcing it
Player Housing as part of the core gameplay loop rather then an afterthought
Crafting-Heavy if you want it to be
No Lockboxes!
Microtransactions that are actually [i]micro[/i].
Develepers that treat players as actual people rather then simply pursebags full of money to empty

Free-2-Play is by its very nature never going to be 100% fair, but when a company actually tries to balance "running a buisness" with "keep things as fair as possible" then I am perfectly willing to make consessions~

author: {'steamid': '76561197968825885', 'num_games_owned': 332, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 3730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3160, 'last_played': 1511408349}
review:
Here is my experience with the game "Stash":

- Was givin bad advice from many experienced community members. causeing me to lose days worth of work and more then all the money I had in game. I had to grind more money just to fix the problems that were caused.

- My Stall filled with overpriced materials that were too high a price for any new player to buy and just right for high level players with lots and lot of money. Even the devs wanted to argue that the prices were fine, when on that same day he was having trouble answering questions about his own game's features to a streamer.

- Removing any item from your satll is free, 1 per hour. Then it cost 25% of the price you put it up for.... NOT 25% of what you make off it, it's not sold yet. I had 20 stacks of low level mats on my stall, so. my options are... wait for the super rich players to evetually deside they want to make a new alt, and try a new craft, in like 2 months. and buy the mats. or take 19 hours, and an alarm clock set to every hour to remove them all, or just dump wasted money into this stupid system to get it done and over with so i can go back to playing.

- Having problems with making enough money in the game. The comunity tells me best way is grinding dungeons. after an hour of grinding and replacing the food i used in combat. I had lost money. Devs and players confussed by how much food I use. Suggest I need better armor or weapons. I have the best weapons and armor possible for my level minus 1 piece. and max primary stat. while playing "the most OP class"... so then i have to question... Is it required that you play the game perfectly? and have the perfect gear at all times? just to be able to sustain gameplay?

- Turns out the reason I'm running out of food is cuz i use too much mana, and burn through my skills alot. who has ever heard of the term "Skill rotation" in mmos? Every mmo gamer ever? oh ok good, just making sure. how is it my fault, that you don't want your classes to actually use their skills, and just melee attack most of the time? but everything is my fault according to the devs. (and i guess i have to be super spasific cuz otherwise the dev can't understand basic english. When i say "you don't want your classes to actually use their skills" i obviously mean, not to use them all the time, like in every other mmo ever, where you have a skill rotation. and when i say "melee attack most of the time" i don't mean all of the time, ... use your skills when needed, Stop putting words in my mouth when any normal person would obviously know what i ment.)

so, I'm Preasured and persuaded into voiceing my concerns to the devs.

- My 2nd time talking with the Dev about my issues with the game, and there is a reason i really didn't want to talk to him a 2nd time, so again... I was told by the devs mutiple times I'm playing the game wrong somehow as i'm the only person ever to have any problems with the game and that it must be my fault. great customer service... tell the customer that they are wrong and it's their fault.... always works.

- The dev thought we should discuss my concerns publicly in the discord chat in front of everyone, where i was insulted by both community members and advisors(dev selected community leaders). As the dev just watched these players in chat and did nothing about it.

As for the game itself. 

- Visuals - I like, altho I would like a walking animation on the world map. The visuals look good to me. altho i'd prefer a greater zoom distance, and a physical "zoom in" rather then a digital one. better yet a free camera, where you can change the zoom and angle as you like. Visuals 7/10 - not bad.

- Economy - Prices for selling items to vendors is a joke if they think those player market prices are normal. The dev tells a streamer: pumpkin pie! a rare food.... so rare it sells for 1, and the 5th club you got sells for 25. and the level of an item barely increases it's value at all, if at all. Economy 2/10 - A joke.

- Combat - interesting turn based combat. fun but overall lacking. not much variety in monster AI. You get a 10% bonus if you are flanking. 10% penelty when surrounded per mob. i'm not going to go into to much detail but, normal one on one vs a mob, takes 2 hits to kill. normal fight with 3 mobs while fully surrounded. still only takes 2 hits to kill. so it really doesn't matter to much. all classes have different skills, but unlike most ofthe MMOs, don't use your skills non-stop, i guess they are very situational, and you go to should just be your basic attack unless you need something else. Which to me just makes every class feel the same for the most part. Combat - 7/10 Not bad, could be better with AI imporvments.

- Crafting - I haven't touched too much on crafting, but, most of my chef recipies call for meat or fish. which calls for trapping, which can only have 1 out at a time at level 1. Which takes an hour to maybe catch one. which I slaughter for the meat. It just takes way to long to get some of the materials. Also crafting the level 1 recipie for boiled eggs give me 60 chef XP and takes 30 seconds.when i hit chef level 5 i went with the lvl 5 recipie for ball of dough which takes 3 mins to cook..... 20 xp.. thats broken. Crafting 4/10 - Needs Help

- Community - Well everyone's personality is different, so everyone will most likely be treated differently. but as for me. Many of the players and advisors seem to talk down to new players. sometimes helpful, but most seem annoyed to hear questions that i guess have been asked so many times. Yes i get it. it can be annoying. 
here's an example of an encounter I saw: 

New player: (advisor) what class are you and your alt? 
(advisor): Check the leaderboards.

Yea you go and tell the worthless new players about how you are so awesome you can't even answer a simples question.

but with all communities you have some good and some bad. Just sad to see the bad ones tend to be "advisors". but again not all advisors are bad. I try not to use names here but "Drack" is by far the best of the advisors, very helpful and friendly. so.. Community 4/10 - Ehh... I'd give it much higher if it wasn't for the bad advisors.

- Overall - 5/10 -


I fell like I could have enjoyed the game for much longer if I hadn't aleinated myself in the community by bringing up my issues, and then having them aired in front of everyone. I wanted to like this game. but I just don't feel welcome anymore, and all the work I put into my character feels like most of it's been wasted. I ended up throwing away mutpile stack of materials worth of time, work, and money in the game. because the old players think I should price my items just for them.

The game is constantly being updated so maybe things will change. But I hope you can enjoy the game if you like it. I can't anymore.

review: I haven't had as much time for gaming in recent times, but when I do, I spend a little time in Stash.  It has the feel of an old school MMO with a bit of a tabletop flair.  The world has a richly devolped story behind it that other games often lack.  In addition to dungeon crawling, I enjoy the crafting system.  There are also frequent events and celebrations to take part in and the community is very friendly and helpful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057414528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 6078, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2597, 'last_played': 1571563629}
review:
As a chronically ill person, I'm house-bound for days (sometimes weeks) at a time, so I'm always looking for something to distract me through the day. I've always avoided MMORPG's due to 1) not considering myself to be a "serious gamer" enough to start, and 2) massive anxiety related to interacting with other people. I am SO glad this was free and I chose to download it - it's unbelievably addictive. The mechanics are explained simply enough that I rarely had trouble figuring something out even without MMORPG experience, and when I do pop into the chat everyone is so nice, so friendly, so helpful. This game has kept me happy and my mind busy for a few days now, and that's worth any amount of money to me. 

So from the perspective of a "casual gamer" with concentration/attention issues, this game is 100% worth it and I'm so glad I found it. Thanks, devs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041860367', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 19745, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11879, 'last_played': 1515260011}
review:
[h1]A work in progress; not for everyone[/h1]

I absolutely recommend giving this game a go, but there are two major caveats.

First: [b]This game is out of Early Access, but functionally it is still a beta, rather than a completed game.[/b] The level cap is currently 30 (out of a planned 100), some of the higher-level skills are still unimplemented, and many features are still under construction. There are plenty of bugs, though none game-breaking. 

Second: [b]This game is different.[/b] Read the whole description on the Steam page. It is quite openly grindy. There is no Auction House (on purpose; don't bother asking for one). Mana recovery is via consumables only, unless you want to AFK in the inn. Mobs and player characters look and move like little pen-and-paper figurines, and movement and combat are on a square grid. Combat is turn-based. The list goes on; seriously, read the entire Steam page.

THAT SAID:

It's a charming game with a retro, tabletop feel, and a small, tight community. And most interestingly (for me), the devs are very active and very engaged with the community. We chat with them on a daily basis, both in-game and in the game's Discord. We discuss ideas and suggestions, give feedback on what we think is or isn't working, engage in general silliness, and occasionally get into heated exchanges regarding game design that go on for hours. 

Give it a shot. Participate in something growing, something a little different. And if you decide to leave, maybe pop back in again after a few weeks, or a few months. See how it's evolved; you might find you like what it's becoming.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030528913', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6026, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5081, 'last_played': 1636510103}
review: Good fun MMO with a very tabletop feel.  Still early in its development, but it shows quite a bit of promise.  Turn-based combat is a nice change from more 'twitchy' games and does a good job of giving a real tabletop feel to combat without making it too difficult to figure out or bogging down the action with too many options.  The Devs/Mods are very active and helpful and do a good job of presenting fun events on a regular basis.  I highly reccomend it for a change of pace in MMO's.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079028113', 'num_games_owned': 189, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1509652336}
review: 아무도 평가가 없어서 씁니다. 이 게임은 역활이 너무 너무 중요한 게임입니다. 생산특성도 잘 선택해야 하고 동영상에서 보이듯이 건물도 꾸미고 업그레이드도 하고 그런 겜이죠. 대신에 레벨업을 제외한 회복수단은 음식과 캠프 뿐입니다. 캠프는 캠프 재료를 따로 요구하고 음식은 비교적 싼 가격이지만 유저가 만든게 아니면 효율이 극히 낮습니다..또한 전사나 힐러의 경우는 초반던젼을 수월하게 도는데 도적같은걸 고르게 되면 영원히 고통받으실수 있습니다...장비도 순수하게 던젼 드롭과 유저제작이 있는데. 모든 도면은 적을 쓰러트려 확률적으로 도면을 얻어서 쓰실수 있는데...제작 한번 하기가 굉장히 빠듯합니다. 왜냐면 채취맵도 따로 턴맵으로 존재하며 필드에 랜덤으로 나타나기 때문이죠. 뭔가 RPG로써 할수 있는걸 여럿 섞어두었는데턴제라서 존나 불편한 게임입니다.게임내 아이템으로 자기 창고는 확장시킬수 있는데. 계정공유 창고는 돈주고 늘려야 합니다. 시대를 역행하는 그래픽은 보너스.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993234114', 'num_games_owned': 946, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1510369481}
review:
I WANT to like Stash, I really do. It's a noble attempt, and it's got some interesting design ideas. But when it comes down to it, the game is miles wide and inches thick. It's a worthwhile time killer, but ultimately, I can't see myself devoting serious time into it. There are so many more rewarding games out there, and while you'll have to spend real money for most of them, it's usually worth it. 

My motto for F2P games: If it's worth playing, it's worth paying for (supporting the devs in some fashion). If it's not worth paying for, it's not worth playing. And at this time, I cannot see investing money into this game.

Edit, a few days later: I spent some time today chatting with one of the Devs, who disagreed with my characterization of the game being "miles wide and inches thick." He and I discussed the game at length, and we both agreed on a few points, particularly for the newbie experience, that needed some improvements. I gather that he made some changes to the game as a result of the discussion, in terms of reducing cost for early "Upgrades." I also spoke with the people in their Discord channel, about many of the same things, particularly the crafting experience. 

But even after all of that, I still stand by my point: The game has many different systems, but they're all fairly simple, not very deep, and not very complex. The biggest problems that you're likely to have are a lack of in-game instruction on how to do things, and running into artificial barriers, called "Upgrades," requiring resources and money (in-game money, not real money - although they're VERY willing to let you use real money to sidestep these barriers) in order to advance, hindering your progress and requiring grind, grind, and more grind.

In its current state, this is going to be an extremely narrow niche game, and the odds of it matching much of the gaming audience is very low. Expect to rely heavily on in-game chat or out-of-game Guides and Wikis to answer questions that will inevitably pop up, questions for information that THE GAME should be giving you. And if you start getting annoyed and complain... expect the loyal followers to turn on you quickly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005772897', 'num_games_owned': 439, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1515542520}
review:
[h1]Updated review includes: cheaper inventory slots, party exp boost, more variety of enemies.[/h1]

------------------------------------

TL;DR:
* Have friends? You all love grinding your passives like in Runescape? Try this game.
* Don't have friends or don't like grinding? Don't bother. Look at my total playtime (6.4h), i'm level 6.

------------------------------------

The game improved since last time i checked, i just came to realise that this is a niche game for a niche audience, and should not be rated bad just because i'm not part of that audience.

No real fun gameplay early on (specially if you play solo), you have too little skills available until level 6 or so.

...................................

[u]The concept of grinding in this game:[/u]

A: Hunting ground > fill inventory with loot.
B: Go back town (sell loot / get quests if you want to).
C: Hideout (personal warehouse and training your craft of choise).
A: Back to hunting grounds with an empty inventory to fill.
Then repeat for hours.

................................

[u]Some stuff i liked[/u]

+ Choose your crafting path (if you play in group, you can complement each other here)

+ Character creation (a bit of planning for the future, nothing huge like choosing stat distribution, just some interesting passives)

+ Character development (non-story-related), once you get to level 10 or so (might take a while) you can eat certain types of food to increase certain character stats in the long run.

+ I'm pretty sure the group endgame content for this game can be amazing later on, but oh lord knows i won't be grinding nearly that much.

+ [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/frogdice]The devs care a lot[/url], they are constantly listening to the community and doing their best to improve their vision for the game.

+ Quest are not mandatory. This is some fresh air for the huge amount recent themepark MMOs.

............................................

[u] Stuff you should know [/u]

* You would enjoy more this game if you payed less attention to the graphics and soundtrack.

* The inventory might fill a bit too quickly if you pick everything (who doesn't want to pick everything?). However, inventory slots can be grinded.

* The movement speed can feel pretty slow whenever you are going a bit too far from home.

* This game feels really niche. Made for people that love to grind, and love to play in group. If you don't like to grind or are a solo player, you'll just bore yourself to death by spending 5 hours to get into level 6 or 7.

* If you have people to play with, and you all love to grind and slowly improve your characters while sharing different passives for maximum efficiency, then you'll have a good time.

-------------------------------------------------

[h1]Below this point is an old personal view for this game, my first experience.[/h1]

[b]It is a bit outdated as of 1/13/2018. Still relevant for me, but not that much as an objective review.
I compared this game against other turn based MMOs like Atlantica Online and such.[/b]

-------------------------------------------------

Now, i'll tell you my story with this game.

I tried to like the game, so far the first few hours are a total and complete grindfest, mixed with a bit of traveling into town to sell loot you don't need.

You start with a very small inventory with an outrageous amount of ingame currency needed to expand it.

So after you kill four or five encounters, you'll need to go back to town, sell stuff, go to your hideout, stash crafting materials, and then go back to grind other four or five encounters until you need to go back to town again.
And i mean you NEED to go and sell things, because naturally you want to buy a bigger inventory to grind for longer.

The game uses turn based combat, yes, but it wasn't fun.
I do love turn based combat, I enjoyed a ton of King's Bounty (sega genesis and then Steam), FFT, Atlantica Online and such, however, this game was pretty basic.

Combat was all about spamming basic attack, one or two skills that only increase the damage you deal (no strategy needed for the early game is guess), and nothing more.
Maybe if the grind wasn't so hard in the early stages of the game then i could have endured a bit more until real strategy was needed.

All i had to my disposal was my basic attack (no pushes, no stuns, no debuffs, no use of the environment).
At least until level 10 or so, you might just be using your basic attack for the most part. Specially if you want to save up on healing items (mana included) because you want to buy that extra inventory.

I mentioned level 10, it doesn't sound that much of a grind tho, but I played it for 4 hours and only made it into level 5. Sadly i cannot endure boring gameplay for too long.

I have faith that endgame can be good, but if the early stages are THAT boring, then i just cannot recommend it unless you are a real fan of grinding.
I even beated the first boss, a rock golem. No strategy at all.

Attack > receive damage > attack > repeat.

The loot was pretty good tho.

By the way, grinding with turn based combat is not for everyone. You'll have so many delays to your grind (wait for each enemy turn, attack animations, encounter animation) you just can't do fast grind on these games. I mention fast grind because early game is way too boring to play it seriously.
It's specially slow if you don't want to go everywhere with a full inventory, and of course you don't want to, since the game is all about grinding and you need to buy that extra inventory slots to grind for longer without going back.

Higher level grinding areas are far away from town, you need a bigger inventory if you don't want to use most of your playtime walking (which again, isn't necessarily bad, but there is nothing to do while walking).

author: {'steamid': '76561198264335255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 2750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 453, 'last_played': 1639289804}
review:
I try not to give negative reviews when I feel a game is actually trying to be good.  I think they are trying.  I just think they are falling a little short.  Below is a slightly long winded account of my first couple days in Stash that led me to my slightly reluctant negative.  If you care not for details and just want a quick summary, scroll your ADHD self down to the last 2 paragraphs.  I'm not moving it up here for you.  Hmph.  Kids these days...

So....I decided to become an enchanter.   
I bought an incantation table and tried to place it in my 'BOO'.  BOO being your player home.  Guess what?  You can't.
You can't place the incantaion table in your home until you level up your home because it has to go indoors and your home at this stage is a sleeping bag on the ground.
  
You need assorted quantities of half a dozen materials to level it up.  Game doesn't tell you where to find those materials.  You go to a vendor to buy some.  Guess what?  You can't.  
Vendors don't sell them.  You have to fight mobs for them.  Because everyone knows bats carry bricks.  Riiiight.
 
You finally manage to find what you need to level up your home to place the enchanting crafting furniture and you click on it to make your first enchantment!  Guess what?  You can't.  
You need Twinkling Dust to make your one beginning recipe.  Where do you find that?  Nothing tells you.  Vendors don't sell it, Monsters don't drop it, you can't farm nodes in the world map or dungeons for it.  You check the 'newspaper', which is what passes for a player market.  You search 17 pages to find it because there are no categories or search methods in the newspaper.  You find some.  10,000 Triads for 99 of them.  As a new player, you are making about 20 triads per battle.  So...500 battles.  Don't worry though, mobs drop a LOT of loot.  It sells for an average of about 8 triads per piece.  So lets say 300 battles to buy some Twinkling Dust.  I don't really mind that kind of grind.  Grind is part of the charm of a crafting flavored RPG.  What I mind is players trying to charge that damn much for it.  I won't reward people for that kind of self centered gluttony.  So you have to search a wiki because there is no mechanic to hover over a crafting requirement and get even a clue of where to attain anything.  The Wiki (which is so incomplete it doesn't even have a description of all the classes and covers nothing past level 5) says you get it by putting enchanted equipment in a disenchanter.  So I have to have enchanted equipment before I can make enchanted equipment?  Logic.

You go kill mobs until you finally get a piece of enchanted equipment.  I had had some before this but sold it out of necessity.  I didn't know I would need to keep stuff I can't equip.  Nothing indicated that.  SO I sold it because you are severely limited on storage and each upgrade you buy only gives you 1 additional space.  Have 19 spaces, buy upgrade, have 20 spaces.  Ridiculous.  Characters level up one level at a time.  Do they only gain 1 health?  No.  Storage should not be constrained to that either.  You don't buy a new closet for each shirt you own.  Logic. 

Next you have to buy a disenchanting station and place it in your home.  Guess what?  You can't.  
Turns out it has to be placed in your yard, not in your home.  Again, nothing at all points this out.

You finally figure this all out on your own (becuase some of us play RPG's for the game aspect and don't like having to use it as a giant chat room to figure out the basics of a system that should have at least some descriptions or hints).
You craft your first enchantment.  Only took 7.6 hours of stumbling through a very unintuitive crafting system.  You joyfully try to apply it to a piece of your mob-loot equipment.  Guess what? You can't. 
It can only be applied to player crafted equipment.
  
So you have to go back and learn how to craft weapons and armor so you can use your sparkly new enchantment.  Guess what?  You can't.
Unless you pay premium currency, you can't learn more than 1 skill.

Now I won't say I don't like the game.  I just don't like where it is at.  It is needlessly vague and cumbersome for no other purpose than seeming to want to force people into seeking help at every turn.  Yes, I do realize it is a multiplayer game.   I  do not, however, see that as a valid reason to force players to 'chat' or get lost.  I don't play RPG's to make new friends, and even the old players get sick of answering the same questions over and over for every new player that wasn't online 10 minutes ago when the last new player asked the same question.  So instead they get pissy, snappish or offer to 'help' the new player by selling them what they need at grossly inflated prices.  Loupe costs 10t from the ONE vendor that isn't selling food.  They'll sell it to you for 1000t. Out of the kindness of their hearts, of course.

I see the course the game is on as being a short road to an obscure ghost town.  That could easily change.  The game has a certain charm.   But when you try to force people in to being friends in order to get what they need, it's going to bite you in the aft-end.  It makes this feel more like a Facebook game than an RPG.  Need a sword?  Invite 12 friends!  No thanks.

Please, allow people to learn multiple crafts without paying for it, put a search function on the newspaper, and add at least a short description of recipe and crafting components on mouse-overs, and it would help the game tremendously.  In the first hour I played this my son said "That looks cool" and he downloaded it.  By hour 7 he said "I'll just uninstall it, it doesn't look like it's worth it to me."  And that is kind of how it feels at this point.  Not worth the time.

So in the end I have to give the game a thumbs down.  Not for the camera angle, graphics, or gender locked races, but for the ununtuitive slog that the crafting is presented as and the immediate need for a premium purchase in order to succeed in that crafting as a solo player.  If that is not the kind of thing that gets under your skin, or if you have a few friends to dungeoneer with that you can pool your crafting talents in with, please, give the game a try.  It is geared towards groups or friends and would probably be immensely more fun with cooperation.  For for a wizened old hermit like myself, it felt punishing rather than fun and I can't recommend that in good faith to other wizened old hermits.

Frogdice, please keep up the updates, take some of the criticisms of myself and other players into consideration, and make a few tweaks to this dusty jewel.  You really could have a gem on your hands.  I would be more willing to make premium purchases from a developer like you who has actively kept up with and loved their game, if I felt there was a future for the game.

Stash on.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993100083', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1611, 'last_played': 1509388500}
review:
If I were to compare this game to others, it's Runescape meets Fire Emblem/Final Fantasy Tactics.

The game is great. Levels feel like they mean something further into the game, crafters aren't overshadowed by dungeon/mob drops. They have value. The potions, armor, and weapons they make are better than any random drop you get. But not everyone can afford crafted gear, so the dungeon drops aren't worthless by any means.

The crafting can be a bit tedious, since you're locked to one crafting profession unless you make another character to help craft or use their paid currency to unlock another crafting slot. And that might scare players away thinking the game is p2w since you can unlock more of your character than others by paying money. It's not.

Now I won't say this game's cash shop is irrelevant cosmetics, it has things that make the things a LOT more convenient. Namely inventory space. This game uses a Bag/bag size inventory system, and you can use their paid currency to get better/bigger bags and unlock bag slots. But you can also do that with the ingame currency called triads (just like gold).

There are mounts, just not visibly shown. The game shows your character more like a Figure than a living character. The mounts grant movement speed, like they would in any other game, and can be bought with both paid currency and ingame currency. But the price/effort between those two is incomparable. 

And it becomes very apparent when someone has a mount and you don't, and you're both heading to a resource node. And with the bag space, more inventory means less time running back to town to sell and put items in your stash. WIth that said, you can find resource nodes when you engage in a fight.

The fighting system is really what hooks me to this game. It's grid based combat, so you have limited movement area as well as ability range. But that's where the combat mechanics come in to have you plan out your next move carefully. For the battle mechanics, there are elemental attacks and mobs with weaknesses/resistences against those. Without a beastiary or monster journal, you just have to go through trial and error or ask in global chat. Lastly, the battle mechanics I enjoy so much is the monster/player placement. You can be surrounded, pinned, and flanked. You can do these to the mobs as well (surrounded and flanked require a party member) and it makes for a much more engaging fight since these effects place a debuff on whoever is affected by it.

This game also features player housing and I won't sugar coat it. It's very, very tedious to manage it. There are multiple materials needed to upgrade the size of your base, increase how many items you can list on the auction house (which is accessable globally, really nice), how many items your stash can hold, and how many crafting tools you can place. When I say crafting tools, I mean like an alchemists table or a weaponsmiths anvil. There's also farming, but I haven't gotten into that since my current profession doesn't need it. 

All in all, this is a great game. It needs work and clarity on some mechanics, but the dev's are VERY active with the community. They have a discord server and always talk to their playerbase. I absolutely can't wait to see what future this game holds.

review:
Cute little casual game, with an interesting mix of turn based board game combat and MMO style crafting and gathering.   It's mainly a grinding game with no real end game.  Fun for a few minutes a day, but gets boring after an hour.   

Well made and seems like the dev's are very sincere about it, so I'll give it a thunbs up for now.  It does have the potential to become a pay to win game though because of the cash shop.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020842791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 494, 'last_played': 1509049936}
review:
Pretty fun solo. 
As any MMO, it is grindy. However, it is pretty fun to play. 

Very enjoyable playing with some friends or even just finding someone to go questing with in the tavern. 

A must try for any looking for a pretty solid f2p game. 
Also, the cash shop doesn't seem too overpowered. Allows for quicker progression on building your base, but not too much in the terms of making your character overpowered. As of now, any equipment from the cash shop is cosmetic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045896617', 'num_games_owned': 7, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1977, 'last_played': 1509076574}
review:
I don't usually leave reviews, but I'm really enjoying this game and wanted to leave some support and thoughts on my experience so far. 

This game definitely has one of the most helpful communities I've ever seen in a game so it's a lot of fun starting out new and interacting with others.

I really like the emphasis on the players really driving the economy, resources, etc. and how the player made items end up being the superior items in the game. The ability to build and design your own base is also a really cool aspect.

The development team seems super dedicated and involved with the community, including actively participating in game chat and on Discord. I especially like the transparency in what they're trying to achieve in the About This Game section here in Steam. I'd recommend new players click the Read More button to see the full description to get a good idea of what the game is about.

author: {'steamid': '76561198437247321', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3642, 'last_played': 1509398409}
review:
I applaud the developers of Stash for creating the most original, refreshing game in the MMO genre in many years. Their passion and vision are evident in so many elements of the game. They clearly set out to create something missing from the MMO genre and they succeeded.

The main game elements are turn based combat, crafting, developing your house (called your BOO or Base of Operations), and social structures (clans, parties, and apparently religions too in the future).

They really nailed the combat. It is fun, challenging without being punishing, and as I gain levels I can see more complexity being added. 

Crafting is done very well and is more interesting than just clicking a recipe and getting an item. There are multiple steps involved in gathering and refining resources, especially crafts that involve farming (for food or leather). I have not messed around with the market much but it looks like you could be a full time merchant also.

Your house is really incredible. It is almost like a full Sims game here. I have only scratched the surface but it is already very cool.

Social structures like clans and parties are clearly a big part of the game, but again I have only dipped my toe here.

Now I need to specifically call out the community which is incredible. This is something really missing from most online games. Too many games these days have toxic communities and the devs done care. But the Stash developers have very clearly put an emphasis here and it shows.

Speaking of the Stash developers, they are very active in game and on the game's discord. Yet again they show how much they care about this game and its community by being directly involved.

I highly recommend this game and hope you enjoy it as much as I have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042385225', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 467, 'last_played': 1550334304}
review:
If you prefer gameplay over graphic, try this.
I mean: I installed Stash 'cause it was free but when I was in game, it reminded me of old tactical RPGs like Icewind Dale II and even tabletop RPGs. Grab some friends who love that and try this.
If you don't have that kind of friend, ask the community : I usually prefer to play MMO alone but this game have a great community.
Seriously: it's free and you can download it in a few minutes, give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041936616', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 355822, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44521, 'last_played': 1536375855}
review:
This game has scratched an itch for me that's been there for a long time.  

It's a grinding game, that doesn't feel like a grind.  It will take hours and hours to get levels in your crafting or character level.  When you level, you actually feel accomplished that you got that level. Even
at level 5.  Even more so when you're up in the 20's.  

The game also doesn't really hold your hand. You will have to figure things out on your own for the most part. Now there are guides and a wiki with some information, but there are things that are just unknown and will have to be figured out by the community instead of getting all the information from the devs.

There's a ton of things to do, with only more things getting added.  Over 600 hours currently in game and I feel like I've yet to scratch the surface.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102537434', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 28092, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24120, 'last_played': 1516101262}
review:
Long, long ago, I made a promise to myself to never review games on Steam; there's too many unnecessary reviews and I didn't want mine to get lost in the shuffle. I felt this game deserved my review regardless, because after 395 hours playing I am still as addicted as the first few days. It reminds me of how I felt playing Final Fantasy Tactics for the first time, grinding for hours and hours with a grin.

As a fan of tabletop RPGs and video game RPGs, this is a fantastic blend of both. It has a lot of the features that you find in your AAA title MMORPGs; crafting, clans, etc. all wrapped up in a turn based combat environment. It doesn't hold your hand or babysit you, you have to think for yourself, read things, and learn some of the more complex game mechanics as you play.

You get to make up your own story as you go, or not if you just want a mindless grindfest with clan mates. It doesn't give you a tutorial, just a text manual that takes minutes to read, and player written guides are available for more detailed information. It's fun and highly addictive, and to top it off an amazing community (ironic, considering most MMORPGs, I avoid the community like the plague). 

I know what you're thinking, "I've heard it all before." This is the first game I've seen in a long time where the community isn't trolls, bots, and gold spammers, but actual people bantering and having fun. The developers willingness to talk to the community, get feedback, implement feedback, and actually fix things is awesome. They are prioritizing improved game mechanics and fixing glitches as well as starting to host RP events to start bringing lore in.

This is a diamond in the rough, but it's being polished as we play, and every update it shines a little brighter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198216041812', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 14688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1617, 'last_played': 1511426680}
review:
This game takes me back to the FF:Tactics and tabletop D&D days.  It's truly a wonderful game, and here's why:

- Awesome staff, eager to help new players get established in the community.
- Awesome playerbase, everyone wants to see the game progress as a whole.  Very chill community with minimal toxicity.
- Although some people may see this a downside or inconvenience, there are certain aspects of the game such as the auction house (newspaper) that are purposely implemented in a way that values player interaction more than most other MMOs.  I see this is a good thing because, like any game, it is important to build strong relationships with other players.
- The game gets updated and patched frequently.  Stash is a relatively new game so balancing every class and role can be a bit difficult.  Luckily, the developer is always looking into character imbalances to help form a more solid experience.
- Also, BOOs.  Getting to call your own personal house BOO is pretty comical. xD


Always looking to play with more people!  
Add me in game: Iskus

author: {'steamid': '76561198090765200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1508390537}

Load out encounter, turned based  load out encounter for gathering. Nooooooooooooooope!  3/10 for some cool ideas

author: {'steamid': '76561198128960636', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3063, 'last_played': 1509932908}
review: Great game, gives the nostalgic feeling of old school D&D without the books and papers all over the place.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960800060', 'num_games_owned': 423, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1504994543}
review:
After playing Stash for the better part of an hour, I can honestly say that I'd recommend giving it a go. What I played was an enjoyable mix of strategy and RPG, giving you a bit of a taste of both.

I didn't have much of a chance to take a look at the multiplayer, but from other reviews and players it seems pretty solid.

The only negative that I've found is trying to visit the tavern. It was a little difficult to get into it, and didn't seem to work when I played it. I'm sure they've fixed that by now.

That said, give it a shot. It's not perfect, but it's really good!

author: {'steamid': '76561198288737855', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1508337768}
review:
Combat is slow, and the game, despite its graphical simplicity, spins up the fans on my Skylake Xeon / nVidia desktop as the game fulls consumes an unrealistic portion of my machine. I was surprised by that until I took a look at the binaries and saw Unity symbols. The Unity developers are responsible for an unnecessarily vast carbon footprint at this point.

The player base seems friendly, so there's that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015030233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2535, 'last_played': 1508309081}
review:
It's very easy to feel lost and like you're spinning your wheels.  

UI seems hand-waved (rushed and forgotten). Ex, some mouse-overs are not applied to all icons, "comparison colour" to know if gear is better or usable not used in all menus where gear can be moused over, stuff like that. 

Progression is very slow; the death penalty can work out to a half hour of play even at low levels, so you need to stick to "safe", low-reward fights (the "yellow" fights are the "step above" you, but if they roll four enemies you might have bit off more than you can chew). 

The NPCs only sell "starter" items, so you need to get everything else from players, but the small player base means a small "manufacturing base". Items "for your level" are likely not available, assuming you can even find them since you have to sift through individual player stores without a search utility and only a general category filter (which doesn't even show all available items; you ned to drill down shop-by-shop to see items which the player didn't apply an "ad" to).  
  
Ultimately, I just kept encountering "minor nuisances" until the total burden of them became too much. It feels like what a company typically releases for closed beta.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135438892', 'num_games_owned': 4732, 'num_reviews': 5177, 'playtime_forever': 948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 739, 'last_played': 1508395836}

author: {'steamid': '76561198005846860', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 206228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9484, 'last_played': 1655431957}
review: Love this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197991174024', 'num_games_owned': 168, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2431, 'last_played': 1627151074}
review:
Game design meant to be punishing to use just for the sake of wasting time and effort.
Toxic community bashes new players for asking questions.
Most of the game is designed around being unusable without spending money on it to make it remotely decent to play. Terrible economy due to unusable sales system with no sorting or searching, it's literally just a list if everything that everyone has for sale in a giant multi-page menu which is completely unscaleable for anything other than it's tiny community moving insanely small amounts of goods.
Dull, anti-fun combat.
Zero tutorial or assistance getting started.
Locked gender/race/class combinations that shoudl have gone out of games decades ago. 

Really, the only thing this is good for is teaching others how not to design a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065153092', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 13101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6118, 'last_played': 1510285239}
review: This is a wonderful little gem of a game if you are into old school rpg type mmo's. It's a lot of work just sorting things out but with a bit of patience and persitence your efforts will  be well rewarded. In-game, I am known as Chromedome, and of all the games I have played throughout the years this one is promising. I only just started playing it but even without a tutorial it's fairly intuitive and when I do manage to have a bit of trouble the community is always willing to answer my questions and point me in the right direction... I've been having some fun chatting with then on their discord server where they even have voice chat enabled channels.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046688559', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 20314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3035, 'last_played': 1527305227}
review: I REALLY like this game. It takes some getting used to and the player created economy is still sorting itself out, but all in all, it's pretty fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150941970', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 15958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8546, 'last_played': 1553313711}
review:
Love the crafting
Love the adventuring
Love the dungeon diving
Love the active moderators
Love the item descriptions... (This is a goat.. It goes Baaa)
Love my BoO!

Most of all.. Love the community!

Warning! This game is not for everyone! Intense grinding. Huge world. Puts reap what you sow to its full extent! This aint your average MMO. Its a fun, relaxing, at your own pace. There are no Gimmies. You earn what you get. IMO very well done! But dont take my word for it! Give it a try! Its free so if its not for you, no harm done!

P.s. This is a Pokka.. It goes Bawk bawk!

author: {'steamid': '76561198430629333', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 9742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7512, 'last_played': 1508370414}
review:
With so many MMOs doing the same old thing, Stash has been a real breath of fresh air. 

Combat is interesting, challenging, and fun. 

Crafting and resource gathering are very engaging. 

Upgrading and decorating your house is almost like an entire game to itself.

As many other reviews mention, the community is incredible. The people are friendly and chatty and make the game worth it all by themselves.

I have enjoyed exploring the world, grinding away in dungeons, and hanging out with the nice people.

The devs are friendly and involved which is a very nice and rare bonus.

Great game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198428237479', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2623, 'last_played': 1510326131}
review:
This game really surprised me. I am a long time mmo player and loved D&D when I was younger and had friends nearby to play with. This game captures the excitement and wonder of those games. 

The turn absed combat is fun and definitely rewards planning and tactics. 

The people in game are really great. I got on chat channels and asked for help and people were very nice and welcoming. 

I am a sucker for good player housing so the boo feature is a big plus. I am going to enter the decorating contest they have this month but I expect to get stomped. 

The developers are incredibly involved and responsive to players. That gives me faith for the future. 

I recommend this game highly and think I have found a new home.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972531919', 'num_games_owned': 146, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 11496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6686, 'last_played': 1536195646}
review: Turn based MMO dungeon crawler, just what I was looking for. Like Warhammer quest, but with friends!

author: {'steamid': '76561198032283686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 25261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11681, 'last_played': 1639874659}
review: This is not a game for people who want everything laid out for them from the beginning. It will take you a while to get what you want, and a lot of times you will have to come across knowledge by testing. That said it is very enjoyable for those who like long grinds and no handouts or handicaps, because this game will make you work for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079278519', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5739, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5528, 'last_played': 1509488061}
review:
I find the game to be addictive and fun, though at times I find myself wanting to know more about the ingame lore. What's up with the different races? What's up with the world they live in? What's the story driving the world, and the people in it?

All that aside, the dev team is active and friendly, and are continuously updating the game. I'm hoping that with new updates (whether they be for bugs or features) there will be additions to help give players a better sense of the story behind the world they're playing in, so it feels less like a straight up dungeon crawler.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007574134', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 13301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11719, 'last_played': 1544933179}
review: Great game that you probably have not noticed.  For fans of turned-base combat, crafting, solo and  co-op gamplay, this is the game for you.  It is designed for both casual players as well as hardcore.  The player community is also a stong point if you need help in learning how to play, or how to play better.  I cannot recommend it enough.  Give it a try and see for yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032281684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 9716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6485, 'last_played': 1509475112}

author: {'steamid': '76561198044036466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 10630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9680, 'last_played': 1508804020}

author: {'steamid': '76561198001975184', 'num_games_owned': 166, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1507397609}
review:
Mixed opinions. But I personally wouldn't recommend it as an adult gamer. Would probably be good for kids, which seems to be the target audience. The aesthetic is too childish for my tastes. Graphics look like they're from 2006 but higher rez. Reminds me of a mobile game in presentation. The UI is simple and the tooltips that come up and tell you about the game mechanics are nice. Camera controls need more refinement, cant set the camera position as low as I would like. The sliding static figures seem a bit lazy and out of place. I get it that its kinda a reference to old table top games but it needs to feel smoother and more animated. Grid-based movement and turn-based combat are nice in an MMO, I appreciate the strategy elements. Just didnt keep my interest past 30 min or so. Not engaging for a seasoned gamer looking for a different MMO. Gotta say I appreciate the devs doing something new but it still feels kinda cookie cutter in presentation and customisation. Be more daring! Tired of the same warrior/rogue/mage/healer go to a dungeon format of game. Maybe if the intro of the game were a bit more story based and less like a tutorial I would have been more engaged. But then again I am probably not the real market for this game. Ill follow the progress of the game and see where it goes but just doesn't really seem that interesting to me at this point in time. If it took some cues from final fantasy tactics or ogre battle in terms of class variety and customization, or added interactive environments or combos with other players that would be awesome. 
OH I should also mention something very positive: simple and short privacy policy information. Devs seem sincere about trying to make a good game and not just a lame cash grab loaded down with bs anti cheating software that doesnt work, like many other MMOs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080174338', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1522351668}
review:
First downloaded the game last  year.  Gave it a poor review because of the very poor instuctions making it very hard to figure out how to play the game. Got some criticism on my review saying there were popups telling how to play. Re-downloaded it and tried to play again,  instructions were still useless or nonexistant. No basic intructions, nothing on basic strategy, no nothing. Got killed in my second battle at 4 monsters  against 1 me.
Don't bother, total waste of time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003181281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1094, 'last_played': 1509679015}
review:
First thing, this game is barely released.  Frog Dice is actively adding content every patch, which are frequent, and someone from Frog Dice is often logged directly in the game.

Overall:  This is a game with lots of potential that I am already enjoying. 

Pros:
This is a game where you will build your character up.  Leveling doesn't give you much.  You need to find better equipment, and most of what you will want will be crafted, either by yourself or from someone else, or will be obtained from loot drops.  

Very much a player-based economy.  Players have easy access to a global market place, so there are few barriers to players selling what they craft.  

Turn-based combat.  I like this a lot.  I prefer strategizing to twitch-based shooting.  

No hand-holding.  Pro or Con depending on your likes.

Devs are online a lot, and there is even a Discord VOIP channel.

Con:
Very little instructions or guides.  You will find yourself asking in global chat how to do things.  Fortunately, the community and the devs are very responsive.  There is a wiki, that is being grown.

Small community.  It's definitely growing, but still small.  This is to be expected considering this is a small company without a big name like EA or Bethesda.

author: {'steamid': '76561198357964452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 52751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28811, 'last_played': 1509814041}
review:
Let me start by saying I LOVE this game, it has an amazing Tabletop Turn based fighting system simalar to FF tactics, it has an EXTENSIVE crafting and housing system, a HUGE open world with plently of room for additional zones/content as time goes on, a very possitive community, PvE Dungeons and Boss's, and the typical gear/experiance ladder you would expect in am MMO-RPG, and some great Developers who listen to feedback and interact with the population regularly.  

The negative reviews of this game with 1 Liners from kids with less then 1 hour played are hilarious, but please see them for what they are, COMEDY, not actual relevant opinion.

THINGS YOU SHOULD KNOW:
This game is Grindy, on purpose, it is not a game where they expect you to be max lvl in a matter of days, crafting and experiance take time.

This game does not have a tutorial and hand holding, you are meant to go explore out of the gates and learn about how things work, that being said there is a "help" section in the menu which will explain a few key details to help you figure those things out, as well as a player made guide on how to get going in STASH, and a great Community to help in game (but please do a bit of looking/reading ingame yourself before logging in and blindly spamming "HOW TO PLAY?").

This game doesnt currently have a "Hardcore" mode, but at higher levels DEATH is punishable with xp debt, which is not a huge deal =D but if your expecting a glass cannon yolo game with no consiquences this might not be for you.

    Stash wont be for everybody, but if youre a fan of a Long term friendly community, D&D, FF tactics, and tons of Favorite games from the 90s this game will hit home with you. Either way give it a shot for yourself.      ~~~~IGN: TimeKop

author: {'steamid': '76561198053110919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 18966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5818, 'last_played': 1508965334}
review: An addictive fun old school tactical rpg.  It may not seem like much at first, but then you wonder where the last 50 hrs went.  It is a work in progress, but the staff communicates with the players in game and updates occur often.  I like that crafting matters in this game, with the best gear by far being made by players.  It is free to play, so no reason to not try it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198193530427', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1509038181}

author: {'steamid': '76561198127730666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1527, 'last_played': 1507258276}
review:
I haven't played this game much, but so far it's been enjoyable. The devs are very responsive and the community is very friendly. 

So far most of the game seems to be about exploring dungeons to get materials to craft and upgrade your player house, along with some rarer equipment drops. 

The crafting system seems to be pretty indepth which is a huge plus to me. There are six different crafting classes, and the game encourages people to specialize in one (though if you want to spend money on premium coins you can unlock more crafting class slots) and the crafting gear seems to be superior than most things I've found while exploring.

A nice feature is the housing system, where you build up your production capacity, and which also functions as your player market where you can sell your crafted or looted goods. 

I'm looking forward to playing this game more, and will update my review at a later date.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002148665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 152791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4932, 'last_played': 1534290387}

author: {'steamid': '76561198366673599', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1506897591}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993000360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1505910701}
review:
If you're a loot goblin like me...you'll probably want to give the game at least a try.

However...one of the dislikes for me is the loot is dedicated to mob drops only.   There is no buried treasure in this game.  The dungeons do not hold caches of gold or unique items hiddne deep within their depths.  
Kill the mobs is the only way you'll get anything in this game.  That's not too terrible...but there's isn't a very accurate gauge of what you're getting into when you ingage a mob fight.  A yellow engagement might consit of 5 dangerous mobs you have no chance against...where as if it were only 3..you'd win the fight and get your loot.

There's only one city from the looks of it..and your house appears to only be accessible near it.  which means journeying far for anything becomes realy tiresome as you constantly have to return to these tow locations to craft and sell.

...and that's the entire game. :(

No quest that i saw so it seemed like the only point in the game was to build up your house.      

*shrug* all in all..just play WakFu.    It's the same thing and 100x better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153826443', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5960, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5715, 'last_played': 1528608516}
review:
TLDR: Simple and fun with a good community. 

Yes it is grindy, never played a game that wasn't. Very good community, develepors are in chat nearly 24/7 that are happy to recieve feedback about their game and also keep everyone in the loop about what is happening, other players in game will also help given you ask sensible questions and showed an effort to look at the tutorial. Yes it is buggy (very small things) but definitely not 'unplayable' like some of these negative reviews say. In the time i've played it there have been weekly updates adding things and fixing bugs. Overall a very enjoyable game in my opinion and defintely worth a try since it is free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065130935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4, 'last_played': 1530068042}
review:
I usually dont write reviews for games but Stash is different.
From the artwork to the dungeons to the community everything about this game is great!
If you enjoy turn based combat and exploring fun and unique areas then I highly recommend this game.
It is free to play and being updated constantly. Also the community is one of the best that I have ever played with in an MMO before. Very helpful and all about makintg this game as fun as possible.
The Devs are on all the time and are very vocal and helpful as well. They take their game very seriously and listen to player feedback and even have a test server you can join to help be sure the latest updates are ready to go!
Please try this, you wont regret it.
