author: {'steamid': '76561198014889390', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 13387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1941, 'last_played': 1512313442}
review:
englisch (german below):

I like the game, it really let you improve something all the time.
But you have to plan and do something, the game is not for the "i want all without effort" people.

You start it and then a few hours are over real quick.

And you can play it good solo without always searching for a group.
It reminds me a lot of the beginning of world of warcraft. Not the actual WOW at which you are bored because you get everything with only 3 buttons mashing, i mean the old one at which you have to invest time, skill and dedication.

And the community is extremly good, no ranting or trolls. Always is someone helping with questions, not like other MMO at which you have to browse first a lot of web sites if you have a question.

deutsch:

I mag das Spiel, immer hat man eine Verbesserung erreicht, es ist schön das man laufend immer einen Anreiz hat.
Aber man muss auch was dafür tun, nicht einfach nur mal nebenbei einloggen und schon alles ohne Aufwand bekommen.

Auch startet man das Spiel nur mal kurz und schon sind ein paar Stunden vergangen ohne das man es richtig bemerkt wie lange man schon spielt.

Ebenso kann man es auch gut alleine spielen, man muss nicht die ganze Zeit nach einer Gruppe suchen. Das ist ein großes Plus, da man ja Spass haben will und nicht nur irgendwo in einer Stadt rumstehen will um irgendwann einmal Spass zu haben.
Erinnert mich stark an die Anfangszeiten von World of Warcraft. Nicht wie jetzt wo man alles nachgeworfen bekommt ohne das man was tun muss. Am meisten Spass macht es ja wenn man etwas erreicht hat auf das man hingearbeitet hat.
Nicht einfach 3 Tasten drücken und ohne Aufwand alles automatisch bekommen.

Die Community hat mich auch sehr stark überrascht. Normal wimmelt es bei MMO ja von Trollen und Leuten die einfach nur ärgern oder sich wichtig machen wollen.
Hier aber nicht, man kann Fragen stellen ohne gleich als Noob beschimpft zu werden.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079414450', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2594, 'last_played': 1507935699}
review:
Świetna gra dla kazdego kto lubi gry w klimacie turowym ala makiety!

Po dwóch dniach grania mogę spokojnie powiedzieć że gra ma potenciał i jest warta zagrania. Wymaga trochę zaparcia i logiki w walce turowej. Jesli lubisz grind to definytywnie Ci sie spodoba. Gra ma ciekawy system housingu w ktorym mozna crafcić róznego rodzaju itemy (craftów jest kilkanascie). Ludzi jest coraz wiecej i jest czesto aktualizowana. Plusem jest też to że twórcy czesto w nia graja i mozna z nimi pogadac na chacie (w jezyku angielskim) o swoich pomyslach albo spostrzezeniach lub pytaniach.

Polecam!

author: {'steamid': '76561198024689294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 667, 'last_played': 1511057955}
review:
I've enjoyed other FrogDice games, they always seem to land squarely in the "flawed but fun" category so I was excited for this one. Unfortunately, in it's current state all I can describe it as is painful. Let's list the issues:

-Painful to figure out
It gives an ok combat tutorial and points out a few things. That's it. Hope you like randomly clicking on stuff in the hopes you can figure out what it does. I couldn't even figure out how to heal, or exit a dungeon at first.

-Painful to read
Holy tiny font, batman. Seriously, the miniscule font size on this game gives me a migraine. The game even supports resolutions too small to actually read the game text at all.

-Painful to move
Like watching your character slowly inch square by square like a lazy chess piece? I hope you do because it's all you'll be watching.

-Painful to craft
I made a Hunter/Farmer, so the sensible crafting profession was Chef. Bad choice. I placed a baited trap and stared at it for a while, nothing. I dungeon crawled and got 2 sacks of flour, came back to no bait and an empty trap. I looked at the newspaper and found ingredients going for 1,000s of triads apiece. I have a grand total of 650. Crafting is currently for the rich and overleveled so what about combat?

-Painful to level
The combat is flawed, like when you click slightly off the monster occupied square so the game completely deselects your skill, but it's not horrible. What is painful is the amount of grind needed to get anything worthwhile is only made more painful by the fact that you will be fighting the same things in the same dungeons over and over and over. Also the loot that you pick up? Most will be vendor fodder but the bit that is sellable?

-Painful to buy or sell on auction -err- newspaper
There's no auction house, which I appreciate, but in its place is a bulky "newspaper" that lists highlighted items being hawked by players. Not a bad idea until you realize there's no easy way to find what you need and once you do find it, it will be so far out of your price range it won't matter. Perhaps you want to sell? Well the game will give you a small "cart" to start as well as give you the starting price for your items. Unfortunately, this price will be far below the current going price amd there's no good way of figuring out the going price.

Painfully dull
- There's no reason given for your existence. You are plopped into the world and ignored. No mythos,  no story, no destiny, no one cares. It all feels like a board game without the fun of a free night spent with your friends. If I want to do hard, boring work for little gain and no recognition I'll go to my job. I play games for an escape, not more punishment.

So, yeah. I plan on trying it out a bit more for old time's sake. Maybe it will grow on me or maybe an update will make it better, but I can't say this game is fun, because it's not, it's painful.
developer_response:
We are constantly adding more in game tutorials- accessed from the (?) button bottom right, and there is also this excellent player made guide (that we link to in game as well):

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1133185739

Font: you can scale up the font in chat and we're working on a way to scale it up elsewhere. 

Movement: mounts are a character progression element that makes you move a lot faster.

Crafting: hmmm perhaps check the crafting sections of the guide? Your experience is unusual and atypical. 

Grind: Not sure what to tell you. We set out to make a challenging game that is not a rush to end game. I don't think design choices are really things to ding a game for. I consider that the equivalent of a Mexican restaurant not serving pasta. It is a stylistic choice. 

Newspaper: Our market is designed to help you find merchants more so than specific products, so full merchant gameplay is possible. That said, we are constantly rolling out enhancements to the newspaper to make it more useful and fun to hunt for deals.

Lore/Reason to be here/etc: This is definitely something we will put a lot of focus on soon. In the meantime, maybe check this out:

http://wiki.primordiax.com

I noticed you played for < 2 hours. I would certainly invite you to check those guides and give it another shot, or maybe check back in a few weeks to evaluate how much we address some of your concerns. 

If you have further questions or need further assistance, I invite you to email us: stash@frogdice.com

author: {'steamid': '76561198012089846', 'num_games_owned': 279, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 532, 'last_played': 1506565667}
review:
The best thing I can say about this game, it's free.  So, go ahead and ignore this review and try it for yourself if you don't have anything better to do with your time.  It'll also probably tickle the itch of the really old school MMO players who constantly bemoan the fall of old games like Everquest.  But, I'm not that crowd, so I can't review through those rose tinted lenses for you.

Anyway, for the game itself, its suuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuper grindy.  Duoed 90% of it with a friend, who suggested we try it.  And, after my almost nine hours, I'm the proud owner of two alts at levels... *drum rolls*  5 and 3.  Out of a level cap of 100.  (And technically uncapped as there's some sort of infinite post-cap leveling system.)  Woo?  I've heard from chatter in chat that it takes ~100 hours to hit level 15.  Yes, 15.  I've also managed to level my base once, once of my gathering skills once, and my crafting?  Nada.  On top of this, there's backwards progression in the form of XP debt, which I saw someone commented can set you back by DAYS of grinding.  And also on crafting:  I logged in before this review to double check some things and my plants and animals for getting crafting mats had died since I last logged on and took all their drops with them.  

Woo.

...not that I could do anything with them yet since I needed multiple machines for processing the stuff, each which cost 1k in in-game currency.  I was looking at probably a 3-4k investment just to make some eggs and potatoes.  And then try to sell in the auction hou-  ahem, sorry, the Newspaper for like... 30 a pop?  ...assuming if things were that simple since this game is really friggin' poorly explained.  Some of their patches are helping it, like a recent one which explains what low level Elementalist skills actually do besides damage, but this game is way too convoluted to have so little explanations.  Wouldn't have bothered with cooking had I known ahead of time I'd be sinking tons of cash for little gain

Speaking of, the economy sucks, plain and simple.  If its not evident yet, this game is a super hardcore grinder.  And the newsaper (which is merely a really inconveniently designed auction house, all in the name of economy, despite how hard the devs will argue its not and will launch tirades about how auction houses are the worst possible thing to ever exist in a MMO) is dominated by super hardcore players mostly charging super hardcore prices for items.  Not that they're making items for my level anyway, and the few bits of junk around my level are simply racing to the bottom of the price and are merely dropped loot (crafted stuff is always better in this game.)  Why?  People are hoarding all the crafting goods and vendor trashing most everything they don't need.  And the developers are making it a pain in the ass for both buyers and sellers to get their goods to each other all in the name of it being better for the economy.

There's... also some other weird decisions done by the devs.  Healing, for example, is super freaking frustrating.  Your only free option is to go back to town and AFK for about ten minutes in the inn, because there's no other source of out of combat healing and its extremely slow to encourage you to spend money.  You can buy camp materials to make a camp anywhere and then AFK and do something more fun in the mean time on the go.  Or you can buy food and potions and fill up your extremely limited inventory space with food items.  I saw a dev comment they did this so cooks would actually have a place in the economy.  But, food raises stats and supposedly does other things too later, so... shouldn't that be the draw?  Except dedicated players are claiming to have already maxed their stats, oops.  And lowbies like me can't even raise their stats yet, so double oops.  And cooking takes an investment of thousands of triads (I'm not mixing up my in-game and premium currency terms, am I?) to even get going for a modest gain, leaving me, a cook, to decide between spending money on stuff to heal and slowing down my crafting progression or spending money so I can craft to heal, maybe make a profit in the future, and be forced to AFK for hours in the mean time.  >.<   So cooks are getting shafted economically from the get go as far as I can tell.  Of course, you can alleviate this by bringing a pocket healer, but they still need food for mana and, since they can't heal out of combat, except to be doing silly things like leaving one monster alive just to heal.  

Okay, so, tangent on healing aside, grouping is weird.  Group members don't participate in the same things unless they "stack" on the group leader and then auto-follow them into combat.  As such, in between stuff, it is their job to take their hands off the controls and wait for the next fight or gathering node or whatever since, if someone starts a fight without them, they cannot participate in that fight.  Ever.  There also appears to be no Round Robin looting, meaning you're going to have to trust someone to actually share stuff, whether it be your leader or other party members.  

Also also, movement itself.  Its slooooooooooow.  And the maps are not designed well.  Like, in town, I started at the entrance and took a stop watch and timed my trek to the farthest merchant NPCs.  it took a full minute, moving optimally, to get there.  Why is this designed like that?  And why are their no walking animations?  It looks really weird and bugs me.  Why is there a separate move command in combat when you have to move before attacking if you want to, why can't I just click like out of combat?  Why do my movement commands randomly cancel, even after the patch that was supposed to fix it?  And why do cat folk use stock wild cat sounds from the 80s that are so out of place?

*deep breath*

...okay, this review went a lot longer than I planned.  And a bit ranty.  But, this game has a lot of problems and really only caters to an extreme niche crowd.  And the developers, while super friendly and seem to be in the actual game interacting with the community often, I feel that they seem to have their heads firmly stuck in the clouds as well about their vision for the game and are missing the reality.  (Yes, the article you love to link to says the auction house was bad for Star Wars Galaxies, which is why you opted against a functional one, but did you read the full article and see where it says auction houses aren't bad for all games?  Not saying you should go the auction house route here, if you're actually reading this, but still.)  So, I can't recommend it and I don't really see myself coming back to it unless there's some really massive changes that make it friendly for more casual play, since I really don't need a MMO to hardcore sink my life into right now.  

So bottomline:  I don't recommend it unless you're the very tiny minority this game caters to.  But its free, so try it yourself if you want as it'll only cost you time and bandwidth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052280876', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1506554770}

author: {'steamid': '76561198004814395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 6702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5955, 'last_played': 1506891830}
review:
A brand-new atypical MMO, that feels like a mix between some old-school Tabletop RPG dungeonning and a Roguelike MUD !

Tactical Turn-based Fighting, interesting Player-Run Economy,  nice Crafting systeme,  Gathering, House Building, Farming, etc..

The Economical aspects are indeed quite promising, as crafted items are better than most of the stuff you get in the loot, so it's worth finding good crafters  in the market to get the better equipment.

Lots of different things to do in the end, time goes on and the game grows on you and becomes addictive !

author: {'steamid': '76561198218249475', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1507603604}
review:
This game is tickeling that itch i've been scratching at since the fall of the great mmo's of the past.. 

Pretty much since wow came out and these gems of yesterday were forgotten.

I'm not putting this game into a box of vintageness as it's ovbious i've only played a very short time as of this post.

But so far the gameplay, The housing system and  basically everything about it brings me personally back to a time when things were less serious and for now I'm hooked.

I'm sorry for the short review as I will be editing it as It progress's Dont let this one slip buy you.

I personally got the founders pack to help the developers along with the progress of this game but it is in now way needed as it's all purely cosmetic.       Which makes me happy I will be using the Cloak that you can use till level 20 for the experience boost that comes with it but for me it's really about just supporting the game's progress. 


Will keep you posted on how it plays out but for now I'm content and look foward to meeting the amazingly friendly community.

Add me in game          "HeavyMetal"

author: {'steamid': '76561198296564267', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 3567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2991, 'last_played': 1528063490}
review:
I'd like to say I enjoyed it, but I didn't. There are a few problems here, one is with the moderation, which I won't even go into for this game, but mostly for me, my complaint is with the broken grouping system, which if you're grouped with people, if said player leaves the battle in the middle of the match, you'll have to kill yourself to escape from the match, which, depending on your level will cost you a day or two of gameplay, or maybe if you're early game just a few hours of your life.

Play at your own leisure. I will not be coming back, not after how I was treated here, goodbye.

I was informed this wasn't the official release, which it is; this isn't an alpha, which people claim it's still in alpha, but it's an official release, and it has game-breaking-bugs in it like this which spoil the fun which is paper-thin to be exact, which are mostly just time synches.

I only lost about 3k experience from the bug, but in a group game, on an official launch, I thought I would be playing something fun, which wasn't broken and flawed.

I've only been playing games since 1985 or so, so don't take my word for it.

Someone didn't like my review so I've edited a few things and added this, just to keep up with the haters at large on these issues about gaming within Stash:

Stash is fun when it's not bugging out. The group system since I've gone back on my word and put in about twenty-five more hours into the game over the last day, is a decent experience overall, like I said, when it's not bugging out, which it will do. The game's experience-pen is avoidable by crashing the game at desktop, which it troubles me as to why the dev has the exp-pen in there in the first place if they can't get it to work properly, along with the turn-based system in place much like in many other tactics games on the market. The game literally can get stuck if a player leaves mid-battle on their turn, and the rest of the group can either; if they know the secret desktop crash or not; go crash the game, or they can opt to press esc, killing themselves off at will, which gives at least 3-4k exp-pen early in the game, from levels 1-10.

They're updating and I'll continue to follow progress. As an early Everquest living legend player, I'll be keeping an eye out on this one, it does hold some of my interest just because I can't stop laughing at it, and it's a good time, just because, the game is so basic in concept, at this time, it's fun to just grind away at it and its rare loot chances, but there are many problems here, too many to mention in this space alone, and like I said in my original review of the game, the game is flawed in a lot of areas still.

As I escape this review I will leave one final example of how limited and flawed Stash really is.

I'm level 10 almost level 11 now, more than 65 percent of my way to level by now, and will so be level 11 within a day or two, and as I type this, there is one dungeon as a solo player which is a level 10 area and scales up, 10-15, but after you clear it, there are really no dungeons, and the ones you find literally anywhere on the world map which are random appear in four locations, one to the north, east, south, and west, which are all on long timers. If you're a fast player like myself and love to clear dungeons for loot, you'll be bogged down by the wait times.

You can find a group. I'm in a guild in the game and do play with friends, but like I said, the bugs in this game wear me out. If you recruit a five man team, you deal with bugs within the battle grounds, so you're stuck with four or six member teams mostly due to this inconvenience. I've put the hours into Stash and these are my findings. Play at your own risk. The game literally has no exp-pen if you crash at desktop, which is laughable as a hardcore EverQuest veteran.

Added 9/29/2017, a note:

To conclude my review of Stash I will say this much, the game is broken as a soloist in its current form, I'll also add that the group game is also a broken mess; early version of game or not, after trying to solo and group in this game, it's not possible for progression at a reasonable enough level for a player such as myself to make a donation, good luck; I've quit playing the game.

Final edit finished by PLR on 9/29, 6:25 PM. I edited it myself. The Watcher of Souls is the writer and editor of this production which I've brought you. I'm the sole creator of this project. And yes, this writer is a dyslexic, no pun intended.

Dyslexicly yours,

The Watcher of Souls

author: {'steamid': '76561198309124738', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 556, 'last_played': 1507780350}
review:
Too complex and as a begginer it is hard to get help with gear, mostly everyone already deleted level 5 gear recipes and finding party is hard. Dying after level 5 now gives this "EXP DEBT" system that force you to spend medallion to get rid of it. Game is excellent in making players rage quit. 

Changed my review from negative, to positive, and now to negative again. Sometimes the best way to help is to be negative. But this is my final stand. Any F2P that baits people to spent $$ is garbage.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058700778', 'num_games_owned': 321, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1558861357}
review:
Allor...cosa posso dire...che dopo 5m mi e bastato capire subiti che Stash non fà per mè, e un gioco troppo lento e dispersivo, non capisco cosa fare per avanzare nel gioco, c'e una grotta provato un combat ma...mi sembra anonimo, se giochi Ranger giocare a distanza non ha senso.

Dall'altra parte forse lintezione era quella di creare una specie di gioco da tavolo RPG virtuale, con classi meccaniche e altre cose, ma sul game play in se e un completo disastro a mio parere, non c'e una quest principale che ti guidi, messaggi che ti spiegano le cose ma sono scritti troppo piccole le descrizioni che non capisi nulla, i modelli e le texture non sono male...se forse i modelli fossero almeno fatti bene, la personalizzazione poi dei personaggi e troppo scarna eccetto la possibilità almeno di personalizzarsi il volto, le pose per personalizzare la pedina sono poche si vede che questo e un gioco in Beta e ha bisogno di continuo supporto e sostegno per migliorarlo, ma al momento non mi fà venire voglia di continuarci a giocare.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080572596', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2071, 'last_played': 1640343435}
review:
Let's break this.
First of all yes there is a lack of different cities and only some dungeon types. But, what's the deal with that? Haven't figured out yet.
      -The characters are limited to one profession only, unless you spend real life money to unlock a slot.-
Yes, but you can still buy it for in-game money to a seller i think, the price is up to the seller but it still will have its price balanced
     -If you want to change a profession you forgot and lose all your progress on the one you alreadry learned.
Yes, as every other mmo like wow...
     -New characters fill up on mostly trash junk and have to run back to town every 5 to 10 minutes..
Then just dont pick the junk... It's a quick way to get some money but not the best. Just pick the stuff u need and save some space for the food sold in town so you can run more time and get more triads on your way.
     -You have to eat food to raise your stats.
Really???
Leveling up does nothing for you.
Yes it does. More HP, more MP, but dmg and resist is very influenced by gear and buffs. And u get it really often from drops depending on enemie level. If u want some lvl 8 armor fight enemies lvl 8 and eventually you will get some
     -No NPC merchants to buy gear from except food.
Everything is player made and the only thing players buy is max gear and max recipes to make max gear.
Such a great way to encourage people to learn some different crafts instead of just running dungeons braindead. Some of them can make pots, other ones lke me can make food, other ones make the tools needed for all crafts... Not a downpoint imo.
     -I did not like the fact that only one player at a time can harvest a resource, ore, wood etc.
Same thing goes with the encounters on the map unless you are in a team.
Wrong, you can carry all the gathering tools and collect everything, but yu have to switch one of the two you have equipped to be able to gather it.
      In addition, i haven't played early acces or anything, the hours i have on record are all my hours played and im just in love with this game and its comunity. Give it a try and ask for help and tips before posting these kind of comments.
Cheers

author: {'steamid': '76561197998014276', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1508891959}
review:
The game is full of little annoyances.

I played a healer and even though there's an out of combat action bar, you can't actually heal outside of combat. That bar is only available if you're in the inn (where you regenerate health/mana), your house area, or a resource node. None of those really help when in a dungeon, so most effecient healing is actually to kill all but 1 mob, then just spend turns healing up the party while everyone else passes. 

Player economy is very cumbersome. There are player stalls to sell things, but there is no way to search all the stalls for a specific item or even pull up a specific players stall. There is a newspaper that advertises items, and you have to click through every item to visit that particular store to see if they have what you want.

Description of crafts/abilties/debuffs are lacking. The elementalist can "shock" something, but there is no description what that actually does. Some enemies "mezzed" me, but mousing over that icon doesn't actually tell you what that does. Biggest complaint would be for crafting, I picked up enchanting. Only to find out I have to place the enchanting table indoors, so I had to upgrade my house area to level 2 to get an indoors slot. I finally make an enchantment and you can only use it on other crafted goods. None of this was explained in the description for learning enchanting.

All of these things plus the grind, just made it to bothersome to continue playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046401011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8100, 'last_played': 1564241306}
review:
This game drew me to it the first moment I saw it.  Stash is the first game I have EVER kickstarted and I do not regret that decision for a second.  Is this game gonna be for everyone? No.  It is a much slower paced, laid back game with more of a focus on grouping and community than the majority of MMO's you see these days.  Is it a grind? yes. But I feel that makes gaining that next level in a craft or class that much more rewarding.  While I realize that kinda of view isn't shared by all I personally enjoy it.

As for the community in the game.  It is one of the most helpful and welcoming ones I have been a part of in a long time.  It reminds me back when a lot of MMO's were new and fresh and players worked together and helped each other instead of mocking and belittling for asking questions.  Most asks in help are replied to in about 30 seconds and usually by multiple players.  Also the Devs are among the most active I have ever seen in a game. They are on EVERY day and constantly talking to players about balance issues, suggestions to game changes and actively seeking to find and fix bugs as quickly as possible for their small team.   It is a refreshing change of pace to see a team actually CARE about the game once it is released and are so passionate about their creation.  

The graphics may not be the prettiest and it may not be fast paced but I feel Stash is a unique gem to those that actually care to examine it for awhile.  If you prefer Tactics style combat with a bit of depth and a community that is enjoyable instead of toxic, I would invite you to give Stash a try.  I'm glad I did :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198074812158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 534, 'last_played': 1506129547}
review:
(May edit review later when more experienced)

Don't take my low hours for granted, it doesn't take longer than an hour or hopping into this game to realize what a gem it is. With an intuitive, unique "tutorial" system that lets you learn at your own pace, I found myself playing a turn-based game in ways I never thought I would!

Combat mechanics that other turn-based games strive for, Stash sets the bar for future turn-based games in many ways. A unique positioning system, aggro, buffs, debuffs, multiple phases to a turn... This game has it all!

The game boasts a modest amount of character customization, even equip with a slider to fine-tune your hero, you have full control over how your character looks. Make them beautiful or... not so much.

The game does have microtransactions, but don't let that dissuade you, everything you can buy with real money you can earn in-game as well, the only except being a few cosmetic "transmogs".

On top of that, the Developers of the game are some of the most active I've seen in a game. You'll often see them talking in chat with other players and helping them. They even have an active Discord!

If you enjoy Indie MMORPGs and are looking for a new, fresh take on turn-based combat, definitely give Stash a try! You won't be disapointed! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198149439331', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1506002775}
review:
Tabletop style, grid based, turn based combat.

Graphics are old school, and there is plenty to do.

If like taking your time with things, this is a good game to try - nothing goes too fast, and lots of things are adjustable to your own needs.

In game cash shop, but not pay2win by any means. Most items in cash shop are buyable using in-game currency, the others you can't buy are for convenience or customizing your toons.

Worth a dabble, will keep my eye on this little niche game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044923724', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4528, 'last_played': 1628821154}
review: Stash is for people who enjoy playing a game rather than beating it. There's no race to the top, just decent mechanics you can enjoy for their own sake. Community has had a lot of helpful members answering newbie questions every time I was logged in. Graphics are minimal but pleasing and the developers are logged in and involved, addressing any problems people run into.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198062122720', 'num_games_owned': 936, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 185881, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44329, 'last_played': 1567904193}
review: I am a veteran of MMOs. I was also an early supporter of STASH through Kickstarter.  I did this because I liked the Frogdice company history.  It has not disappointed. It is familiar yet unique. The game is cooperative with a very helpful staff. It also has a friendly group of experienced players willing to dedicate time to assist the new player in learning the game.  It is not necessary to invest large amounts of cash to have an enjoyable game experience but it will not hurt also.  The game is morphing in a positive direction because the developers listen to the remarks of the players.  The gameplay can be casual or intense depending on the desires of the individual, it does not cater to a specific gameplay. Being an experienced and mature player, I have noticed recently an influx of immature players who have introduced an element of vulgarity into the game. Hopefully the developers will take steps to stifle this trend or they will lose market share. I wish them well and hope to be a long term player.

author: {'steamid': '76561198318892777', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1505957741}
review:
Honestly, i was expecting a fun time in this game, but it feels too much of an alpha to me, rather than an actual game, I don't care if you fanboys wish to say something like "UR A FILFY CASOOL 1V1 ME IN MY MINECRAP SURVR!!11", but still, this game has too many flaws that will drive away first timers.


Flaws:Terribly done movement between areas, lack of character creation hairstyles, an awkward "awesome" when you upgrade something in your Base Of Operations (BOO), loot drops are too generous, dyrads for being considered another race (Its just a female human with another name on it, i don't get it), etc. (And this is from a first impressions standpoint, there are alot more there too, but movement in general is my biggest problem, it feels too annoying to do.)


Pros:Community isn't terrible, heritage and an active community (I couldn't think of other pros, somehow.)


Before you complain, this is from almost 2 hours of gameplay, and when there is nothing to pull you in to the gameplay, then whats the point of playing if you don't enjoy it?


I'd call this game an... aquired taste for some people to be honest, it isn't that good, and i'd doubt it'd be something i'd want to play again, but some people may like it i guess.


My rating is 3/10, and my Comment on this is:Still better than linkrealms.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034569093', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 15727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7946, 'last_played': 1507350312}
review:
The Game is Totally Worth the Price of Admission~!
It being F2P, and costs nothing, you get a bucket of Fun for nuthin!

The scope is not too wide, options not too deep. Yet the path is yours to carve out as there is very little hand holding. The DEVs are highly responsive and engaged with the community, practically attached at the hip at this point. They crave player input and suggestions. You will see them every day talking to players.

The classes, professions and skills all seem well thought out. Leveling a character is only as much a focus as you make it. Working on Professions and Skills is seperate. You may get to use Gathering Skills while Adventuring, however it's not needed or expected. Wandering the world hunting for resources is its own fun and you get more faster if your focus is that over killing monsters and Dungeon Crawling.

Loot is wide and varied, perhapse a little too varied. However you can sell the bits you dont want or Need on your personal Store Stall. Like the EQ Bazzar environments without the Lag and Overcrowding. With the player community growing and being very active there is plenty of opportunity to trade and help each other advance goals.

The community is outstanding and genrally interested everyone's needs and skill levels. Help is but a chat away on any number of things, game or real life related. There is low tollerance for unsocial behaviors in open view. The few instances of Trollishness and Disrespect are met with a tidal wave of resistance to that kind of behavior. The game is very Family Firendly! If I had young children coming of age to get online, I would support them playing this as their First MMO, without constant supervision. Then feeling completely comfortable playing with them at any time and having a blast.

The Development looks like it will be ongoing for some time. The game is very well presented as is but the projections on future features is very impressive. My personal 'Brass Ring' will be in future inclusion of Pub Games, such as Darts, Cards and Dice games. The Dev's need your input on many future design concepts.

Join Us Today, & Stuff that Stash to Bursting!

author: {'steamid': '76561197963914960', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 5903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5894, 'last_played': 1506241136}
review:
I don't usually bother writing a review but I've decided to make an exception as there are waaaay too many negative reviews floating around, being unjust to the game.

Basically, when you start in this world, you get hit by a welcome screen that asks you to read the general info. Having done that, you are given info about combat, dungeons, the town and your BOO(Base of operation) as you reach those stages. All in all, it gives you the basic info to thrive and learn - and learn you should do. It's not a steep learning curve, but it does require thought, trial and error. If you struggle, luck would have it that devs are active A LOT so big plus to them - but most importantly - the somewhat mature playerbase, are ready to help. 
Game is quite active, chat is always going - and one of the best things I've seen is a) you can do important stuff from lvl 1 and b) devs listen to the players.

If you miss the good old days of adventuring and taking things in your own pace, this turn based combat and social interaction MMO might just be for you. It's not a pay to win but a pay what you want - i'd say 99% of items in game can be had without paying... 

There's an interactive market where you can sell your stuff to other players - and even level 1 stuff will be useful to someone - it's a real price-demand market. 

It's been a long time since I've had this much fun in a multiplayer game - no fast combat - no big flashy numbers - just relaxing and fun. For what's implemented so far, I'm having a blast. 

TL;DR - try it out, give it a few hours to get the hang of things and don't forget to say hi in chat. Maybe even try out a group dungeon crawl. It's fun, it's free and it's addictive ... :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198137756293', 'num_games_owned': 93, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1516051112}
review:
i found this game to be nice...
until devs tried to argue me wrong.
 i was planning on fighting back but i swear they had a banhammer up their sleeve for me.
what i was talking about? letting people lower prices.
they said "too many people would fall for it (forgetting how easy it is for them to reformat the text that pops up, I mean TAKE ONE LOOK AT THE FUCKING CHEAP UI)" and "it would cause a crash like the Itunes store (forgetting yet again how expensive things are, and how everything on the in-game market is inflated to the moon and back)"
what the economy needs is TO BE CHEAPER.
i wouldn't care if the max they could go below price is 50%, i would prefer that, YOU'D GET A FUCKING GOOD DEAL INSTEAD OF THE CASTLE GROUNDS! but of course, the devs were agressive to say the least about the idea of cheaper minimum prices.
i thought it was good, until my only friend bolted ahead overnight, going 2x my level (i was low level) which was annoying, but i barely cared. i left for a while... i would care more for my cat being stubborn in his heated bed refusing to follow routine than to care for him.
or for this game.
i signed up for their emails and today i got another saying things that brought me back. little did i know, they hardlocked the economy. into an inflation spiral.
this game is 50% economy, selling junk you don't need and buying things to make a profit. but when the economy sucks and (if you don't know by watching videos) the rest of it sucks (graphics, battling, movement, gathering... that's basically all that's in the game) you can easily give this game a pass.
the game is fun... for 30 minutes. then grindfest happens.
someone tell me why this game survived.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025694051', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1504976951}
review:
Wyglądało jak coś świeżego, interesującego. Turowa, taktyczna walka w MMO brzmi jak święty graal, jednak wykonanie okazało się bardzo przeciętne, albo nawet ciut gorsze. Być może nie udało mi się doświadczyć zabawy w pełni, przez okropne lagi i opóźnienie - przemierzenie kilku metrów w poszukiwaniu bestii zajęło 10 minut. Ponad to gra nie zabardzo stara się wytłumaczyć cokolwiek, zostajemy wrzuceni do świata i mamy sobie radzić. 
Osobiście trzymam kciuki, bo być może w przyszłości uda się poprawić błędy i będze to przyzwoity średniak do miłego poklikania wieczorem.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984368578', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2871, 'last_played': 1506519185}
review:
I wouldn't say its complete by any means, but there is plenty to get your hands on and play with.  Nothing about it in anyway is P2W and the dev team is very active, responsive and engaging,,,

If you love table top games you will like how this plays out. Its not a game for everyone but has a lot to appeal to different play styles when it comes to MMO's.

The players are generally very helpful if you are in need of assistance (some things are not intuative but can be figured out).

Give it a shot, you'll know pretty quickly whether or not its a game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129443963', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2506, 'last_played': 1535120751}
review: A great game. Takes alot of patience and grinding, but you truly can have fun even with those things. This is a fresh game and is newly released as F2P. The economy is just starting and crafters are still low level, so nows the chance to make your mark and become a merch , crafter , or high lvl character before the mass. Devs are constatnly in chat with us, asking for new ideas and concerns and are working very hard to keep updating and making the game better. On top of these things, the community is great! Everyone is extremely helpful and fun to talk to, and guildes are still growing as well, so the aid recieved from them is top tier. Great game, highly reccomend giving it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201880358', 'num_games_owned': 16, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1505321244}
review: Si un juego como este fuera 2d pero si cuidaran las interfases, la calidad de los modelos, la dinámica de las batallas y te mantuviera enganchado diariamente un par de horas este juego hubiera recibido premios al mejor juego del año. Pero en la condición actual, tan descuida y desprolija, no la puedo tener en cuenta como opción F2P y tampoco recomendarla a ningún jugador casual.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016505817', 'num_games_owned': 296, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 9640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5442, 'last_played': 1511066935}
review:
No I would not recommend this game to most because it requires time and effort to play it, this game does not hold your hand like most braindead skill spammer games do. This plays like a DnD table top game you would play with your friends at home on paper and a drawn out map. You need a few brain cells to understand how this game works and a WHOLE LOT OF COMMON SENSE! Which a lot of gamers these days seem to be lacking, to many log in asking what kind of game is Stash, learn to read before hitting download on a free game xD

Otherwise, yes stash is a little rusty but that is because they had a very small beta testing team that most of wha's being found now was not an issue. BUT! The staff is working everyday to try and fix everything they can. Since luanch on September 7th 2017, there has been 5 patches trying to fix what the large number of players have found that the few missed. They fixed the lag from being DDOS'ed in 12hours!!

It took Albion online 2months to fix their DDOS problems and they have over 40 team members and working slower then an indy developer. So if you are looking for a game that is a real challenge and not a cookie cutter "Be level 20 in 5hours" circle jerk online, give Stash a try. Once you start, you'll see why it's called No loot left behind!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006431462', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1505440529}
review:
There is so much potential here but unfortunately this game is currently designed like a phone app money trap. (Annoyances purposely designed into the game with the only way to overcome them done so through buying gems)
A pleasurable experience will cost you several hundred dollars as a minimum.

Update to address comments:
I couldn't agree more Do_Be...

As for for the developer, I understand this is personal for you. I can only imagine. As such please know I understand and respect your passion for your creation. I must respectively state that while I understand and appreciate your free to play model, I believe you have been a little too aggressive with the purchased "conveniences".

As for "examples of purposely designed annoyances":
1.) Shared stash is one slot and can only be expanded by spending real life money.
     a.) In my opinion this is a purposely designed annoyance meant to force the players into purchasing gems to counter this.
     b.) Again, this would be manageable if it were a little more reasonable. 1 slot is too few. Show the players you have good intentions and they will reciprocate in making purchases.
2.) There are 6 crafting types but a character can only learn one. All knowledge is lost when switching.
     a.) Only way to expand crafting slots is by using real life money.
     b.) This would be manageable if the shared bank/stash was reasonable. (See #1 above)
3.) Players can't change harvesting tools in combat.
     a.) I can't comprehend why this would be designed this way. This isn't enjoyable at all. Nor is requiring us to equip the specific tool in order to perform the harvest action. Again "in my opinion" this should be redesigned to make the experience enjoyable for players. As it stands now, it's just another annoyance without any perceivable reason (that I can see anyway).

I still stand by my opening statement. This game has so much potential to be a great game. I'm perfectly fine with the typical free to play model and I have a history of supporting developers by making real life currency purchases. (I've spent thousands within individual games)
I believe it would be far more enticing if the limitations put in place to promote purchases were rebalanced.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045381877', 'num_games_owned': 557, 'num_reviews': 2587, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1505327099}

author: {'steamid': '76561198035772226', 'num_games_owned': 384, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 53270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2776, 'last_played': 1527464268}
review:
Not your typical RPG nor even MMORPG.

This is turn based combat.

It requires though a bit more than button mashing though it's not complex.

There's leveling, crafting, combat skills, and a bit more.



Pros:

*Player market.

*No pay to win.

*Highly involved devs.

*Great graphics.

*Active development.



Cons:

*still lots of development to go

*needs movement work

*needs more robust tutorial

*Might be a bit slow paced compared to your normal RPG



It's still in its infancy.

Being free I recommend giving it a try.

The community so far and the devs have been super helpful.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987731882', 'num_games_owned': 596, 'num_reviews': 517, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1505165847}
review:
Its not exactly a bad game.
Simple mechanics of four races, several classes and stats to strive in.
Camping for materials to work on crafts as the game titles implies.
Much consideration on what trade to pursue and invest your loots in,
setting up shop for your products and even decorating on your plot of land.

Social and economic tradings are much necessary in the long run,
really need few like-minded friends to constant party with and contribute to a cause.


BUT

Lags, Stutter, Slow and Inconsistent pathing of your character,
is the biggest setback of the game.
Taking a few step, you might stall for a bit to few seconds, or even lagged backwards to one of your previous steps.
Crowded locations where others are also heavily camping for the kills,
the lags only get worst.

Ingame purchases of the medallion are costly and only through the main website with a vague fillin the credit form.
Package DLC in Steam Store are pricely for its mere usefulness, 
would be more efficient to list medalion packs for sale through steam or simply click in game and paying through Steam.
Expansions for skill slots is gonna cost you, or fall behind the others.


A Free game that could be playable, 
A Grind with friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003599172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 12375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6396, 'last_played': 1506286746}
review: This game is pretty unique. It's very focused on crafting and community. The developers are very active and communicate with the community and I'm fairly certain lacking a lot of sleep thanks for the fixes and patches they've released since the game left early access. The players ingame are very friendly which helps because the game isn't newb friendly, especially if people skip the help pop ups. There's a moderate learning curve but once you get past it and understand how things work it really gets fun and rewarding. As long as the community remains fun and fairly friendly, and as long as the devs keep up the great work I think that this game has a good future ahead of it, especially with all the things they have planned.

review:
This game woln't be for everyone, it doesen't hold your hand, there aren't many guides, there isn't even a search in the player market, or a world map, but all that is fine as it wasen't designed with hand holding in mind, those that want an easy ride are gonna have problems, but for those of us sick of the easy mode most modern MMO's hand us, give Stash a try, it's free and trying can't hurt you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989375601', 'num_games_owned': 973, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1309, 'last_played': 1502584291}
review:
Stash is a Free-To-Play MMORPG with turn-based combat, crafting, dungeons, and base building.  The developers have built the world around their previous works, with lots of history and lore to come with.  They are dedicated to bringing constant updates, bugfixes, and content to their players; even hosting events and interacting to get feedback and provide special bonuses.  

Being a Free-To-Play game, they do have an RMT currency in the form of 'Medallions'; however this isn't a paywall and you can obtain anything important to gameplay through the in-game loot and currency.  It's mostly there for ease of progression and cosmetic features.

On a more personal note, I have followed this game since the kickstarter campaign, and when they first had working builds I wasn't that excited with what was there; but the developers have been hard at work to provide better and better gameplay, and now I have a blast.  I expect that this trend will continue, as the team seems devoted to making this game the best they can envision it.

So if it sounds like something you might enjoy, give it a try, it's free. =)

author: {'steamid': '76561198355503126', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1213, 'last_played': 1615050994}
review: Turn-based table-top mmorpg.  This game is old school, and it is not going to be for everybody.  It's got its fair share of bugs and glitches and there are definitely a few features that could be worked on.  With that said, this game is amazing and addicting if this is the type of game that interests you.  The community is (mostly) great and very open to helping new players.  The game takes some getting used to, but once you do it can be very hard to put down.  I definitely reccomend the game to anybody who's got the extra time on their hands to try it out, or especially anybody into old school rpg's.  The game is relatively new to steam, and still being actively developed, so if you don't like what you see now, come back a little later and you may like the changes.

review: Turnbased MMO with were you can play with friends :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198002771734', 'num_games_owned': 557, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 7751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5964, 'last_played': 1506048346}
review:
well uhh,,, i spent more time with this game than i expected to, leveling up the different crafting  job to level 3 and experiencing each player class up to level 7.

Stash is an mmorpg that transfers the aesthetics of a tabletop rpg into a mmorpg setting, through looks and some mechanics. i found it enjoyable and recommend it, however it needs work to live up to its' potential and get where it wants to be.

Starting out youll be creating a character with the overly familiar 4 classes (mage, cleric, warrior and hunter), a choice of 4 races (which affect your early game more than they affect the higher levels, by the looks of things) some cosmetic stuff in form of your character's look, heritage and  your figurine's pose.

the game world acts similar to old tabletop rpg's, having player characters and interactions(dungeons, monsters, resources etc') marked with figurines, and movement being tile based. many mechanics involve rng, allowing for "fails" in movement where you encounter ambushes or your crafts end up a disaster (and the obvious rng loot). 
combat is turn-based, and features an interesting flank-surround-pin mechanic where positioning can mean a lot for your success in a fight, bringing disadvantages or benefits depending on coordination between teammates. outside of this it is very basic and most of your solo fights will be trading blows with npcs and montsers until something dies.


the pros:
-flanking mechanics in combat bring an interesting value to positioning most games forget about.
-each class is viable even if you did not choose a specific class and race combination for the stat bonuses.
-the dev team interacts with the players and are open about their plans for the game's future.

the neutral:
-enconomy is very much player based, with everything besides the most basic of tools being drops or player crafted(and player crafted items being the stronger option)

the bad:
-combat is very bland at this point.
-gathering materials often involves guesswork, where despite carrying the proper material in your bag you cannot use it if you did not equip it prior to the encounter (personal taste ofcourse, as it is a gamble mechanic and in the situations you bring the correct tools you have potential to earn more than you would when gathering normally)
-the intro to the game is very confusing, and goals are entirely up to the wants of the player. while this is good in a sandbox game, this also scares off a great deal of new players who are not in the mood for reading the guides when starting the game. a simple tie-in tutorial, with use of the player's heritage, would allow an easier and more welcoming learning curve.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006412514', 'num_games_owned': 1059, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1505062426}
review:
Good idea, but has it's flaws.

Movement at least for me is to clunky,,in fights it's ok with "grid movement", but moving around in the world should be more.. fluid? (imo that is,,some ppl obviously like it this way.."virtual boardgame")

It needs somekind of story to kickoff new players with as in all mmos, as is you're pretty much just dropped on the board with no pointers what to do or go.

And as always with a itemshop..hide basic mechanics behind a paywall is never a good idea..6$ for another crafting slot etc? that's a few hundred bucks if you want to craft it all
No thx..!
I rather buy the game, get basics that should be in the game and pay for cosmetics and possibly boosters, housing items etc.
And this is the gamekiller for me and the ones I know that tried it.
Money isn't the issue,,it's about principles and I stand by mine.

But as always, we all like different things,,try the game and form a opinion of your own.
There are good things in the game as well.
But for me,,it's a no go. 

Imo It has a Early Access feel to it, and had it been that, I'd probably give it thumbs up, waiting for things to be added or changed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986153432', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4916, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3107, 'last_played': 1506032452}
review: Came for the loot - stayed for the community. Easy to make friends and quickly find a group to raid dungeons. So far Stash seems to be an awesome foundation for a promising game. We shall see what comes for Stash in the future, still feels very early access, but looks to be heading in the right directions. Devs are very active in the community and host events occasionally. I would like to see improvements regarding "Elite/Boss" Mobs, "World Bosses", PvP, Tracking quest progress, contested nodes, loot filters/systems, tutorials/in game tips, and the leveling grind for both combat and crafting currently is a slow, but the game still feels engaging and your time invested into gathering/farming feels compensated when you have achieved your goals. If you are looking for an easy game that holds your hand you might want to give Stash some time, as currently there is a lot to explorer and if you're not willing to ask questions and/or take the time to learn something new, you might become frustrated.  I hope that the Devs aren't in over their heads but only time can tell. Overall you cannot hate Stash for what It is trying to become, and I admire the Devs for their ambition. The game is very unique and after investing the time to learn it you might fall in love with it. I know I have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018821714', 'num_games_owned': 655, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 13751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4094, 'last_played': 1507424164}
review:
TL;DR: I give the game an 8.5/10. The haters are just bitter people who showed up and cursed a lot and then got smacked down by the mainly SUPER-nice community.

Full Review:
While the game is still in very early stages, it already has a lot of fun to offer. It has a "table top miniatures" art style and feel to it, which is very appealing for those of us with backgrounds in pen and paper RPGs or tabletop mini wargaming.

The combat is sequential turn based on a grid. Players have a basic attack and accumulate new abilities as they level up. The game takes into account details like having enemies pinned against a wall or surrounding them (or being on the receiving end of that kind of thing!).

There are several different crafting trees to try out, one at a time, along with many gathering skills. The crafting system has more depth than you'd expect at this stage, which is great.

The dev is like a machine. He's almost always logged in, in chat, talking with (and LISTENING TO!) players right at the door to the main city. Dev involvement like that is worth its weight in gold. He freely gives out an e-mail address you can send suggestions to, and is always quick to engage with the player base.

You also get a home base called a Base Of Operations, lovingly referred to as your BOO. You can level it up to expand it, store things there, and decorate it for cosmetic appeal. You can also add functional things like crafting stations, gardens and animal pens for fun or harvesting, etc.

Overall the game is pretty great conceptually, and is already in a great state even this early in development. Over time there's a lot of promise here for a casual to intermediate-intensity gaming experience. I recommend it highly. It's free to play it, with a cash shop, but without the pay to win feel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053566058', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 8227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5912, 'last_played': 1538203874}
review: I've spent hours playing this game, and while OF COURSE there are bugs, lag and some issues, (its newly released game!!) but it's highly addicting, and hard to stop playing. It's grindy, simple yet strategical, and the graphics are adorable. I highly recommend this game to anyone who enjoys a more laid back, RPG, turn-based battle type of game because this is perfect for you. Not to mention the AMAZING community. Moderators and other players are always willing to help out, and answer questions. Just have a little patience when it comes to the bugs, they are definitely working hard and fixing things every day ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198083580729', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1505083006}
review:
Man, where do I even start...?

The idea is okay. Not great, but just okay. It suffers from a lot of things, namely a lack of player direction. You're dropped into the world with no clue as to what you're meant to do, who to talk to, nothing. You're given a "help guide" when you go into something new (combat, base of operations, etc.), but it lacks so much detail that it essentially is just there to tell you "Hey, this is *insert name of thing here*, here's a couple of things that can be done, good luck."

Combat is kind of okay. Sadly, it gets incredibly boring very quickly, and becomes a repetive snorefest after a few minutes. 1, click, 2, 1, get attacked a few times, repeat. The first few dungeons offer some crafting materials, but nothing in the way of usable equipment. You can also get housing stuff, but you can't even place them without a house, which requires materials and "triads" (the game's currency, earned through quest completion and selling loot). Like, a LOT of triads. Your inventory and stash also start out so small that you're essentially forced to take maybe one or two things to avoid filling them both up. While you could upgrade your stash, that, too, requires materials and triads. Again, more grinding.

The game world is devoid of any sort of interesting PoI's. You'll find nodes for gathering crafting materials (which require a bunch of different tools), some battle nodes (with color-coded difficulty "peg" bases), dugeons (private, world, and random varieties), and towns. Other than that, it's mostly flat land, some plateaus, and that's it. Nothing particularly interesting.

Dungeons are...well, painful. They're a pain to navigate, a pain to fully explore, and a real pain to work in with other players, especially since so many will continuously farm enemy nodes for XP and drops. The camera's wonky view and controls certainly don't help either. You can't zoom out to see the whole dungeon. Instead, the camera switches to a top-down view, and only shows a small portion of the area. Like I said: Painful.

Give the devs time to get this game more fleshed out before you consider playing it. At the moment, it's just simply not worth the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962122763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1141, 'last_played': 1599407210}
review:
Sure there are a few problems. All games have them especially within the first bit of full release. If you have played any games (especially those not huge budgeted) in the last 20 years you know this. You also know if you have played big budget games in the last 20 years, most of those had game breaking bugs at release. Nothing in Stash is game breaking. There is lag for some people on overland maps. It is horrible when it hits. It's being patched and actively worked on by the devs. Why cry about it in reviews? You can't figure out what to do? Probably should have read the pop up tutorial tips but since you didn't...ask. It's a multiplayer game folks. Just hit enter and type. You don't get your hand held with this one. Wrestle with it a bit and when you get too frustrated ask and someone will help you I am certain of it.

The feel of the game is old school pen and paper to me. Difference is I don't have a fridge of mountain dew and my friends sitting around rolling dice. I have a keyboard and a mouse. Is it a bit grindy? Sure..AS IT SHOULD BE. You want the easy button then shop at Staples. Is it hard? No. Easy concepts and simple combat dynamics that can be manipulated to give yourself (or party) an edge. Takes all of 10 minutes to figure out (or one pop up...remember I mentioned those. Read them!). This game feels built for one thing. Fun rpg experience. 

Play the game. It's free. What do you honestly have to lose? You're reading the reviews. You could already have it downloaded and tried out by now.

Just my 2c

author: {'steamid': '76561197963810509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 14047, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5473, 'last_played': 1507067097}
review:
My inital response was 'err, this isn't what I thought it would be', so I dove into the game to actually try it properly (instead of the constant 0.3hr reviews you see).

At first, it took a short while to get going, tutorials for the moment are limited to the short in game help screens. There is a Help channel and a world channel, where 99% of all questions I've seen asked have been answered within 30 seconds by someone.

After getting the basics out of the way, I started to explore the world, the dungeons, my BOO etc.

Your character is represented by a non-animated figurine on a stand (think old-style Dungeons & Dragons tabletop miniatures), with a fair bit of customisation available from the start. There are currently 4 different character classes and 5 or 6 different races (each race has a bonus to one starting stat). Starting stats even out around level 6-7, so the main choice is in no way game breaking, and your best bet is to choose based on role-play or fun purposes.

The world (currently) consists of the main town, the Overworld, your BOO (Base of Operations - which is your stash / stall / and crafting area), and 2 dungeon types - world dungeons which are open to anyone, and private dungeons which are solo dungeons. The dungeons are also level set to a range (eg 1-3, 3-9, 5-10) which you can change from your party settings (even if solo), so you can fight easier or harder mobs as you wish.

Combat is turn-based, with actions done in order (various spells can change the orders / stop creatures acting). You can move and fight, or, move and cast, in a single round, and you can also harvest corpses (or resource nodes which sometimes show up)  provided you have the correct tools equipped.

Xp, loot, and sometimes triads (basic currency) are awarded at the end of a successful combat, with loot being anything really - recipes, crafting mats, weapons, armour etc. 

The gameplay overall is very slow paced, so don't come in expecting COD/CS:S/<insert other fast game here> speeds, but this works nicely as you need to spend time to upgrade your Base, your stash, your stall and your harvesting and crafting skills (if you want to craft that is).

One thing I noticed while playing: there are VERY active Devs who sit in the game world, answer questions, help players, listen to suggestions etc, which I found very refreshing, and very nice to see.

Devs have also mentioned changes to various systems they have coming after listening to player responses to the game so far - again, very nice to see.

Overall, a bit of a bumpy start to a new game release (stupid ddos'ing script kiddies), but I highly recommend you give the game more than 20 minutes of your time if you like this type of game - you won't be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035354701', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1505030089}
review:
It might be a fun. Maybe it will be. Sometime.
At the moment it is not.

Lag time between moves: 2 minutes.
Unplayable.

Continuation:

So. The company claimed the lag encountered on Sep 9th was because there were 10times the number of players they expected. Well, that sounds like a success. Indeed, the lag on the map where you start with a character is mostly gone. 

So there was actually a chance to test how the game works.
However, my initial assessment that the game is not worth playing only manifested after getting the chance to actually play.

There no such thing as a tutorial.
There are explanations, but they're not really helping. So, I started a combat. Movement and using abbilities is pretty straight forward (esp. because you only have 1 methods of attack, 1 melee and 1 ranged, yay for variety). It plays out like a farily simple board game, which is ok for a turn based MMO. The game doesnt explain to you, what kind of damage you do, it doesnt explain to you how many damage you can expect doing. Looking at stats doesnt help you figuring out anything.

You don't even see what items you're wearing, because there are only icon slots in your paperdoll inventory but they don't show the equipped item (at least, I assume items where equipped because in the inventory LIST they were shown as equipped, but who knows.

After you're injured it sounds like a great idea to camp, because camping regains mana and health, you're told. Now comes the fun part: You need camping materials. Fortunately, the game tells you where to get it. You can buy it in the ingame STORE. Yes, to get health back the first thing you're told is how to pay real money. I suppose there's a way to get the camping materials without paying real money, but of course, you're not told that. 

I think that's all I need to know about a game - or rather the business concept of their developers.

Still, I tried to enter the city in hope I could perhaps sell some of the loot I got during the 5 fights I won. After staring a minute at the loading screen, I killed the game in the task list.

Actually, that is what should have been done to the game: Kill it before it was ever published.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003893149', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1504984518}
review:
I honestly had to come back to the store page just to see if it was in Early Access because I'm quite surprised this was released as a complete game. Stash is a neat concept on paper, but the execution of the game is horrible. The game will frequently lag, whether it be from the game itself, or spammers making everyone have a good time. The movement feels very clunky and unresponsive, as does the combat. It's not complicated by any means, but it just doesn't feel as solid and responsive as it should, though it is admittedly a bit better once you start using the hotkeys. 

There are also a number of bugs as well, such as fights not ending sometimes when you finish off the enemies, so you have ot take a move, end your turn, rinse and repeat until you make it to the treasure chest. The XP bar is also, as of writing, useless and doesn't tell you a single thing. You have to manually type in /xp to get this stat. I'm not sure how an XP bar can be messed up like that, but I imagine it's not exactly a hard bug to fix. 

The gameplay design is also a bit wonky in other aspects as well. You get a chance to pick a skill to go into, be it cooking, enchancing, smithing, etc. HOWEVER, to actually do things with it, you need a special item you put in your BOO (Base of Operations), and a tool to gather resources. The former you cannot actually use until you upgrade your BOO, which is not explained. So why bother giving me the ability to try and learn a skill if you're also not going to actually let me use it? The resources you need to upgrade your BOO aren't something you'll just grab along in a dungeon or something, I'm honestly still not sure. But I've uninstalled, as this game's design is just too terrible for me to try and keep going on. The description intrigued me, but until this gets patched (probably multiple times) to fix some of the more glaring issues, I can't say I'd recommend this to anyone.

review:
This game is really bad. For the following reasons, I highly recommend you NOT to play the game.

1. Pathing of the character in the game is all wrong 

2. There are no clear details as to how the players should proceed with the game

3. Extreme lag for the movements of players in the game when walking around the map.


All in all, I would say that the developers of the game has not really think throughly of how the game is and has never thought about it through the shoes of players. There is no clear goal in the game and it is definitely really hard for new players to enjoy and play the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993941180', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1325, 'last_played': 1505110341}
review:
Absolutely fantastic game.

Being fresh out of early access this game brings out a lot that everyone wants out of their MMO/Tabletop RPG.

The team's communication with the community is absolutely astounding, there has been and continues to be nearly constant communication from the development team.

As far as game content goes, it's an ever improving  enviroment that is expanding with every update.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007006002', 'num_games_owned': 178, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1504903570}
review:
В принципе, стандартная ММОРПГ, мы видели таких тысячи. 
Из особенностей:
- мир стилизован под настолку, а герой и монстры под игровые фигурки.
- пошаговые бои.
- есть крафт, можно добывать ресурсы.
- есть личная поляна, на которой можно отстраивать базу.
Больше и нечего сказать. Перемещаешь фишку по карте, пока не придешь в данж. Перемещаешь фишку по данжу, пока не дойдешь до монстра. Убиваешь монстра, получаешь лут, переходишь к следующему, пока не надоест. Возвращаешься на карту. 
Выбор тактических боев для данной игры мне кажется ошибкой. Тактика имеет смысл при действии группой или когда существует большой выбор возможностей взаимодействовать с противником и окружением. Когда закликиваешь противника, чередуя фаербол и молнию - походовый режим ни к чему.
Отторжения игра не вызывает, просто не показалась достаточно интересной.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043711616', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1504976550}

review: They don't even put enough monsters down i nthe world for the number of players so you really have to party up or do the solo dungeons.  Issue is in order to farm solo dungeons you have to log out after clearing them for mobs to come back.  This wouldn't be an issue if it didn't take all of 3 minutes to do a dungeon and the one I did didn't even get me half of the way from level 2 to level 3.  Not going to log in and out repeatedly just to level later on.  Its a no from me.

review: Initial impression only: Game is a bit awkward to play and feels very old-school but it does not take long to get used to the feel. Camera angles can be difficult to work with and the help information is very limited, BUT the community is very helpful. There is crafting and storage in your BOO-base of operations (though limited at first, you can upgrade with the items that drop as you play). Even with the oddities I did enjoy the game. Found the battles to be reasonably challenging and fun. I have not played long at this point and will update this review when I have played longer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022076782', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1504874712}
review:
Note: I didnt play for long, but right away you notice the numerous problems with this game. 

- Insaine amounts of lag for the few people who play it, they dont seem to have any server support. I got stuck for 5 mins right at the start just waiting for the game to catch up.
- The graphics look like a 95' CDROM game, no excuse for this day and age. 
- The combat system is very slow and flawed, allowing others to steal mobs you were about to kill, and there are problems with the loot system as well. 

Overall, It looked so promising, but like all games that come out of no where.... is a vast disapointment.

------------------------------------------------------------------

Edit: Ive noticed people blaming ddos attacks for my bad review. The lag is a part of it, however that is just a drop in the bucket of whats wrong with this game. In no way reccomend this game to anyone, even if they ddos is real. (Hint Hint: its a good excuse but who would even ddos this sorry game?) 

One Positive I will say is that they have staff on who are paid to interact with the players, so thats a plus, too bad they downvote any criticism of their game as can bee see from the helpful review % of my comment here.
