author: {'steamid': '76561197993564293', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2980, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1211, 'last_played': 1505359008}
review: Great potential for this game.  The world layout is grid-based, your character is a token that moves like a pawn on a chessboard, reminiscent of the Hitman or Tomb Raider phone game.  Some players have complained about lag/rubberbanding, but I played the game on launch day and never encountered any lag.  The added bonus was that DEVs were live ingame, chatting and helping players the whole time.  [b] HUGE [/b] A+ for that. Also, remember to read the "Getting Started" guide in the help index when you start the game, it will answer all of your questions.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993701462', 'num_games_owned': 223, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1505024844}
review: Very fun game with a strong positive community. Almost all interactions I have seen so far have been very kind and helpful. The game itself is very fun and has a lot of potential. The developers are very active and quick to respond to feedback. I would very much recomend giving this game a try. There is a slight learning curve, but all of the info you need can be found in game or on their wiki. If you are a fan of table top gaming or just the aesthetic, I think you will enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077418326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1344, 'last_played': 1512583017}
review:
Overall it's a great game and it's addicting. There good range of classes and races to pick from, many specialized skills, and best of all, you can create and customize your own house, or BOO, as they call it. The devs and Vets of the game are very welcoming and extremely helpful. It has a great friendly community, which we aren't use to today. I recommend this game to anyone who likes a good social RPG.


In addition... The Devs are extremely active in working with the players to make this game as enjoyable as possible. Don't listen to the reviews that have .5 hrs played, it's a meaningless review. Truly, this game has tons of potential and I'm looking forward to all the updates the devs plan for this game. 

Try it out! See how you like it.

review: Really fun game! It really made me feel like I was playing my favorite tabletop RPG right on my computer. Character creation is fun and highly customizable. Everything is bright and eye catching. The controls are simple and easy to pick up once you get going, and combat is especially fun (and satisfying when you kill all the monsters and get that loot)! Definitely give this game a shot, especially if you enjoy tabletop gaming.

author: {'steamid': '76561198177873294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1504845167}
review:
Pros:
-Tabletop-esque MMO with character sheet styled progression.
-A good fantasy feel.
-Fantastic admin interaction with community, very helpful(when not being asked how to move).
-Charming if you like the graphics.

Cons:
-Feels like an early 2000's release, even though it's only just now in early access.
-Movement imput delay of about 3 seconds on overmap which can end up in fits of moving randomly and being told over and over you "cannot move there."
-Community has the hallmarks of toxicity already, with most people being very snarky towards the most frequently asked question;
"How do I move" - Linked to the input delay on the overmap which can cripple you when you start, only for you to get chewed out for asking about it.

Idk, could be good- but definitely not for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071760031', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1544566986}
review: this game is TRASH!!! on the very first day we were all put on a boring landscape in the middle of a grassy field with a giant castle near by....we moved by double clicking our "playing peices" like you would of a normal board game... there was NO introduction...NOBODY to greet me... NOBODY to guide me to get started....just pretty much (heres the game, go f*** yourself) kind of a thing....so i figure things out pretty quickly....there was a cave near by where i started at... it said levels 1-3... hey!!! i'm level 1-3 i thought... so i go in... theres tons of people inside there. it appears all the players are battling the creatures with in. you litteraly have to wait your turn just to jump to the first monster you see. so i get a few turns... yeah i got the hang of the battle and all. it wasnt great, but i got the jist of it....what really bugged me is, partying up with someone didnt allow me to join the same battle my partner was battling....so whats the point in partying then huh? if i cant join them... whats the f-ing point? also the starter point was rediculously laggy....people were always asking... how do i move? how do i move? but you couldnt....there was like 50+ people all in one spot. the game wasnt ment to handle such a rush of players...and get this. the developer wants you to pay lots of money to buy camping gear so you can set up a camp just to heal yourself....otherwise your screwed... hey? you need a bandaid? go f*** yourself... pay me money first....thats what the developers are like. they give you like 80 free magic orbs....but the camp gear that makes camp fires to heal yourself is 100 magic orbs...yeah!!! you have to fork over real money or just not enjoy the game. this game wont last long... sure theres a rush of players now... but the ratings will change that. so glad i didnt pay $15 for this....thank you.... thank you for giving me a free to play game...until you change the problems, i wont spend a dime in the game....and yes i'll check back to see
developer_response:
1) There are tons of players and developers talking to everyone and greeting people as they enter the game.

2) Camp materials do not cost real money. You keep posting this everywhere but it is false. You can get them for 100 triads, and triads are the regular game coin/gold you get from monsters as loot.

3) There are tons of private instanced dungeons where you don't have any competition at all for mobs to fight. The first one is suggested in the tutorial screen that appears immediately upon entering the game. (or you can press the ? button and click the Welcome to Stash page).

4) Of course you can fight with your party. The leader has to initiate the combat though with all of you together. This allows people in a party to go off and fight separate battles if they want/choose to. But to fight together, pile onto the leader and let the leader move you around and start combats.

5) You don't have to pay money at all to do the things you mentioned. That is just a 100% lie.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090937744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1504830203}
review:
Far too unpolished for any kind of beta release.

Minuses
*  1-3s latency on walking. It's a pain. Also the mouse pathfinding is terrible, so expect to WASD your way around.

*  Poor interface design. Want to mouse drag treasure every encounter? No thank you. Clicking to end combat? No. The town, like the interface, suffers from poor planning. Good example:  entering a flashing area and then clicking a small button just to get a shop menu. The shops are spaced very far apart. You can tell I value my time. I didn't find the town to be pleasing to the eyes.

*  Remastering of sound needed. The sound effects were too low compared to the forgettable background music.

*  Smarmy devs. It's not smart to tell players to "get a mount" when your server gets back to them when it wants to. Instead of being proud of your creation, you need to learn to be ashamed when you put on a terrible first impression. No wait, it's not a first impression because you manipulated the release date. How do you like that one out of the bag?

Pluses
*  RPG system had some substance
*  Tooltips for stats, you can tell what to build on your character
*  Colorful artwork, inviting to the eyes
*  Tutorial combat was solid.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972425292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 661, 'last_played': 1510948453}

author: {'steamid': '76561197968832867', 'num_games_owned': 378, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 16895, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4303, 'last_played': 1551924460}
review:
Updated: 9/12.
I want to love the game, it has elements from Dofus and Project Gorgon both of which are pretty good indie MMOs. Touch of Wildstar in there as well.

However I don't love it like I should. The UI sucks, the bugs are plentiful and there's not much to do but kill and craft. I enjoy killing and crafting though. 

Combat is slow, a lot of elements of it are poorly (or not at all) explained and there's still a lot of work to be done. 

Potential is hidden in there, but there's not a lot of meat, not a lot of population and not a lot of reason to play.

I'm changing it to a positive review now that it's free, because it is worth trying out just to play a MMO that isn't the same garbage.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991391480', 'num_games_owned': 329, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 969, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 909, 'last_played': 1499634398}
review: Poorly documented and the female characters are over sexualized.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031388984', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 12403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12093, 'last_played': 1515784042}
review:
At this point early on some of the things are polished, many need continued work.
The graphics are simple but work well for the game.
The game never crashed and everything was smooth for combat being turn based. 
It is fairly challenging to figure out what to do and how to get in a groove.  That itself is worth a few dollars.
After 20 hours I figured out eating food all the time, selling everything, and having several harvesting tools on your character are all critical.  

If your looking for a simple fun game to spend some time go for it, I believe it will improve with time.  IF your looking for 
total polish you may be dissapointed.  Videos and websites and even forums telling you what to do and how to do it are not going to be in abbundance.

For the price of a soda and some snacks what can be the harm.

150+ Hours Later . . and f2p opening up
The game still holds interest for me.  You do figure out tactics, what potions to use, what equipment to seek out or make for your character.  With the advent of some game updates you can adjust the scale of Random dungeons to suit your needs.  

Everything I still holds probably more true now than the day I wrote it.

Enjoy

author: {'steamid': '76561197976806268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1531056239}

author: {'steamid': '76561197967843880', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 2283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2021, 'last_played': 1511072054}
review: The grindiest game I've ever played in my life. 16 hours to get from 8-9 and it's level cap is 100!!! graphics are meh, not bad but not great still bogs down in some dungeons, graphic settings change nothing so I just run it on fastest. crafting is a pain, if RNJesus doesn't love you, you're not going to get very far. Spent 3 days trying to harvest materials, received a gift of lumber from another player and got to maker lvl6. Next day a chef turned maker was lvl10 >_< Combat is nice, makes me want to play WAKFU again.  Pay if you want to support the devs, for now I say avoid unless you're super casual or want a second job with no pay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045205980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1959, 'last_played': 1498666908}
review: The only thing missing from this game is YOU!  Seriously I am loving this game.  I have had it for 2 days and the only time I haven't been playing is while I sleep.  And when I sleep I swear I'm dreaming about it lol.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027435254', 'num_games_owned': 134, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1534059977}
review:
- Whined like a child about basically forgetting my username and password.
- Developer was all, 'Hey bruh, what's good?
- Helped me gum it out live.
- Patched a gnarly interface snafu preventing redemption of code.

After a few hours of play, I like what I see. Great graphics (which have actually improved in clarity since the last time I loaded it up) and an in depth but well explained crafting setup.

- A good amount of materials drop from battles.
- The ability to buy items/bonuses with pay currency AND in game currency within reason (indie devs can learn a LOT about this sort of setup)
- What appears to be a pretty cool housing concept/FOB.
- Lag/rubberbanding has been reduced since I first played.

10/10 would make myself look like a moron again. This review will be updated as I play but, excellent job so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001878976', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1045, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1045, 'last_played': 1508819140}
review: I supported this game when it was in EA cuz I thought it looked good and it was definitely fun for a bit, but honestly there wasn't much improvement from EA to release, and I personally feel it wasn't ready to be released at that time. Since there have been some interesting improvements and updates, but nothing that really makes the game feel ready. This is of course only my opinion and I'm sure some people will have problem with it, but that's just the way it goes. The movement is still pretty twitchy and combat is extremely lackluster. I enjoy roaming around and collecting resources, and crafting is somewhat fun, but needs a LOT more variety. All in all I had hoped it would be vastly improved by now, and I stilll hope it gets there one day. I will of course be looking in from time to time to see what's happening, and will most definitely change my review back to the positive that it was during EA if I see some big improvements, but for now I personally do not recommend it in it's current state. Good luck to the devs and keep at it, the potential is still there :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198061841404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 680, 'last_played': 1496185962}
review:
I love to play this game.  My big issue is that it states that you can play Co-Op.  However, I have run into many problems playing co-op, from not being able to load in to not being able to move during my turn in co-op.  My husband and I were so excited to play this game together, but we have to play separately.  That was a big bummer.  I did put in a ticket and updated it consistently over the past 20 days, but no feedback from Frogdice.  I will play single, but we still want to play together.  We both purchased the game to do so.  Hopefully this is fixed before full launch.

UPDATE:  The company had missed my ticket due to a 3rd party ticketing system.  Next, they worked closely with us to be able to be able to resolve the issue.  It was a very oblique bug that had not been found before.  The company fixed it immediately and now I am able to play with my husband.  Great game!  Love it and cant wait to play more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198204884744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1512927047}
review:
It really only took me a few minutes to get drawn into Stash. Back in the day, I was an avid table-top gamer and the look and feel of Stash took me right back to that. Plus, the idea of literally infinite amounts of loot to be hunted, multiple variations of characters to be created and creatures to battle - as an indie title, it really had everything I had been looking for in an adventure/RPG game. I come from the old school where the Legend of Zelda was king in the adventure/RPG genre. In fact, I feel like that one game defined how all after it would go. Stash reminds me a lot of the old 8-bit Zelda.
     I have been following Frogdice Games since my days at Cheat Code Central. I interviewed the team and played a few of their games before they ever hit the web. The folks at Frogdice are simply the best kind of people and have a lot going on at any given time. But it is that fevered pace that keeps them pumping out games like Stash, Reignmaker, Dungeon of Elements and so many more. Having a dev team like that brings something very cool and very personal to the table. 
     Stash really is a fresh take on a classic . I am logging in right now to play even more of it. If you haven't at least given it a try, you totally should. I don't think you'll be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987093786', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 9353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5880, 'last_played': 1526570969}
review: Stash is a very cool old school rpg with timebase combat. There is lots of options and there is going to be a lot of custimizing with your character. Farming and livestock is going to be an update soon to the game and they keep making it more interesting. The goal for the goal is making a very social rpg with players who love to roleplay and make history for themselfs in the game and you can be a part of it! Come join me and others who alrdy loves this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021784092', 'num_games_owned': 540, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 14956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13231, 'last_played': 1516383497}
review:
First off I am one to shy away from early access games due to alot of the Developers deciding they got the money they wanted and leave you with a unfinished product or finish the product but dont fix the issues. What I like about Stash is that not just one Developer that plays Stash and Talks with the community but the whole team does as well. The Stash Community is also willing to help out anyway they can to make sure that you feel welcome and a part of the community whether you have been playing MMO or new to it. This is one of those games if you and your friends are looking for something different or just a change in the scenery but same Genre then I believe you and your friends would enjoy Stash.

Note: Pros and Cons subject to change based up full release 

Pros
+Helpful and friendly Community and Development Team 
+Development teams willingness to listen to the community
+Options and classes they have right now
+Being able to customize your home, craft and sell your items to the community
+Trade System 
+Trade Crafting, Maker, Armorer, Weaponsmith, Cook, Alchemist, Enchanter
+Personable Game all around.
+Not a Pay to win MMO though you can buy Medallions for special costumes, extra inventory, special mounts, but those same items you can use ingame money you earn to buy same things

Cons
-Sometimes Laggy
-Leveling up seems slow but they have events that gives Exp boosts to help with leveling 
-some of the tasks are not completed ingame yet so will have to wait till completed
-Somewhat of a tutorial so it can be hard to figure out in the begining but gets easier with time and community. But this issue is    being worked on 

Overall

This is a great game that I would reccomend to anyone thats looking for a new game experience. Yes it is Early Access but after talking to the developers and watching them interact with the community like they do I see this becoming one of more popular MMOs on Steam. This is a Gem worth having in the library.  If you do decide to purchase it Come have an ale with me at the INN ask for Tetzu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198360514210', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3021, 'last_played': 1511298737}
review:
I've been waiting for a game like this my whole life. I've enjoyed many MMOs in the past but have had enough of the whole autoattack/white damage/use abilities on rotation style of combat. That was fun and all but I've done that enough now. 

Player housing has become an important feature to me and is one of the first things I look for in a new mmo. The housing system here in Stash (they call it your BOO or Base of Operations) is the best I have ever seen. They say your BOO is like half your character and I believe it. I can't believe how many ways you can upgrade and level it up. 

I hope this game gets a lot more visibility soon as it really deserves to have a huge playerbase. I know I will definitely be telling all my friends to jump on board immediately. This is a perfect type of game for early access as the devs have already shown they listen to players and that means we get to have input now into the direction the game will go. That's cool.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049391746', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 13613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8471, 'last_played': 1574850869}
review:
There is so much i love about this game. 
The Devs love to talk with the players and they listen to the players input. 
It's constantly growing with new features. 
The player base are willing to help new players and are very friendly.
The shop system makes the players feel more like a shopkeep then any other MMO.
Tons of humor in the content.


Some downsides at the moment.
Early Access game: Like all early access games there will be bugs.  
There is tons of low level content at the moment but it is a slow grind to level past level 10 (lvl 30 max ATM). 
The BOO's (Base of Operations) are mostly private cosmetic's ATM since others can not see them. (Will become open later.)

 If you plan on joining keep a eye out for Gragus (my character). I am always willing to help new players find there way around the world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035798231', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 15065, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4343, 'last_played': 1539512657}
review:
I had issues with my registration (the account system management is not final yet) but the CEO took care of my problem :) on a saturday! 
Thank you

author: {'steamid': '76561197976367869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 10000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1804, 'last_played': 1653239178}
review:
I have followed the development of this game from it's first Alpha to the point that it is now in Early Access. It is a blast to play and I can already tell that there is much more to come. The groundwork for a truly amazing and tactical combat system is in place. All of the classes are different to the point that it almost feels like a different game when you play them. They also mesh very well together so you can be sure that you will find a niche in a group. Most of my play has been solo so grouping is not required.

The graphics give it a very bright, tabletop RPG feel that is definitely inviting. The bright colors and amusing enemy names make it family friendly.

If you are looking for a fun (My five year old loves it!) romp through an MMO that is destined for greatness, you could do much, much worse than Stash. It promises to be an amazing game that is breaking the mold formed by recent games and bringing the fun back to MMOs. You really have to ask yourself one question: How much loot can you fit in your stash?

author: {'steamid': '76561198041539422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1483414149}
review: Good game if you enjoy looting, dungeon crawls and stats. It has plenty of content already from what I saw, though there's some rough edges. I chalk the roughness up to it being in Early Access, and from what I've seen on the posts, the game is updated fairly often. I think it will only improve over time. If you like table-top style board games, and also looting games, this is a safe bet.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999138003', 'num_games_owned': 633, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 2190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 869, 'last_played': 1520736063}
review:
,,Stash is bringing the magic back to MMOs.''
I can really see this happening.
The game wants you to feel at home and i think that it will be a paradise for roleplayers later.

+Tabletop art style(gives the game a very unique atmosphere)
+Turn based combat that makes you think about your next move and encourages teamplay.
+Housing that isnt just a small side feature but one of the games main features.
+Multiple ways to customize your character(different races,selecting a RP background,choosing a pose and peg for your character,customizing the face,choosing armor or weapons for your costume).
+Dungeons that spawn at a random place in the world.
+Monsters can ambush you while travelling.
+Funny quest and item descriptions sometimes ;)
+Very nice community.
+RP friendly.

-The current revival system makes dungeons too easy to solve.
-Not many jobs to choose right now(only 4).
-Small playerbase.
-could become pay to win in the future(i will keep a eye on the itemshop and the medallions but reviving with medallions and upgrading your BOO with medallions allready sounds worrying).
-You cant visit the BOO of someone else and you cant walk around in it with your character(might get changed later).


The game lacks a lot of things but its allready more playable than many other early access games on steam id say.
Also,there will be milestones.
That means,the more you achieve in the games testing phase,the more you will be rewarded when the game releases.
If youre a fan of olschool fantasy and tabletop games,or if youre into RP,give the game a try.
Its definatly very unique.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015615545', 'num_games_owned': 318, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1499122538}
review: While it's definitely lacking in final-product polish, the gameplay is remarkably fun, and controls are pretty straightforward.  Definitely worth a look if you like RPGs, turn-based strategic combat, and/or good crafting systems.  =)

author: {'steamid': '76561198047929922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1258, 'last_played': 1481611224}
review: Very glad that I discovered this gem.  Character creation is a very nice addition for this style of game, I REALLY like all the customization options.  The dungeons have been a blast to advance through, and to build up my stash.  As opposed to all things picked up being vendor trash, I definitely enjoy the crafting aspect of the game.  I did not expect this much fun in such a short period of time, but I have EASILY gotten my money's worth.  Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198350867892', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 31929, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1407, 'last_played': 1510177743}
review:
This is a really special game that I hope gets a lot more attention soon.

Indiegames are my thing but I rarely take the time to post a review. This game delighted me to the point I had to break out of my usual shell and share my experiences.

The MMO genre has grown pretty stale. Everyone knows this. How nice it is to see an INDIEDEVELOPER finally step in and change things up. This is why indie games are the most important thing in this industry. But I am distracted.

Every facet of this game is simple at first but quickly reveals layers of depth. Combat. Housing. Crafting. Character development. I have only scratched the surface but I already see so many layers. 

When I read the forum for this game I see a development team that cares a lot about this game. That is one of the most important things for any game but especially online games. Does the dev team love the game and are they devoted to it? It is very obvious that Frogdice loves this game and wants it to be great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198349986850', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 82456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1381, 'last_played': 1514411184}
review:
Stash is pure fun with a lot more depth than I expected. Combat rewards thinking and strategy. The BOO (your house) is the best player housing system I've ever seen in an mmo. The community and developers are excellent and I can already tell will be huge reasons I hang around for a long time.

I have already seen so many interesting ideas or new twists on standard mmo mechanics. These developers have definitely set out to bring something new to the mmo world and I for one am thankful for it. 

More people should know about this game! I really enjoyed playing it solo and it was also a lot of fun grouping with other people. The tactical elements of combat became even more interesting then. Most of my friends hate early access so I can't get them to play yet, but I know they will play once the game has its full release. 

I would like to see a little more information early on explaining how things work and maybe more information in tooltips. I saw on the forums that the developers are already planning to do this, which is very encouraging. 

In summary, this is a wonderful and interesting game that I am so glad I found!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027483587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1505434391}
review:
It's kind of like a tabletop RPG/board game MMO, and it really is quite well executed. If that sort of idea sounds intriguing to you, I really think you should consider getting in on this.

edit: 3/26/2021 Seems the game is pretty much dead :( The small community that existed a few years ago has ghosted.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994131861', 'num_games_owned': 43, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1017, 'last_played': 1544969616}
review:
This game is really amazing and has come a very long way.  It's a great game to be able to borg, craft, as well as build your BOO.  The music gives you a bit of a rush in combat as it sets tone of "ok this is serious!"  

The biggest plus and advantage to this game over others are the admin staff, they actually CARE and want you to enjoy the product and they will strive to listen to the community as well as update, expand, and make the game better.

You also won't find a better community of gamers than the ones who have supported Frogdice over the years, they really are a great company, and really do care about customer service.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999264751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1012, 'last_played': 1511052669}
review: I have been having fun playing. It is missing features (early access) but it has potential. I am looking forward to updates.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019500649', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1479047452}
review:
If you're thinking about buying this I'd recommend you watch some Youtube videos on it being played before getting it - its combat is extremely slow (even for turn based) and needlessly faffy. I got bored and disliked its mechanics even before the first fight ended.

It's early access of course so that could all change.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970653621', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1436, 'last_played': 1477608363}
review: Stash is a great MMO still in early access.  What really makes wonderful is the awesome community and always expanding depth and breadth of content.  I'm and early backer, so I've seen the progression of new content.  Stash, like the universe, is a world which will expand at a rate faster then you can explore it :)  For me, that is the difference between a game I play until I beat and a game I explore for years and never get tired of.  You should play.  If you do, You'll look back on it a few years from now and realize you spent pennies per hour of entertainment which imho is the hallmark of a great game.   The real gem of the game is the community which is very friendly, supportive, non douchey, and funny.  The developers are available, responsive to the community, and pleasantly subtly humorous.  I could go on for ever.  Just give it a try.  You'll love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052144103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1478701627}
review:
NO BEARDS. 1/10. My reign as Saruman ended very quickly.

Other than that, it's a solid 7 for showing promise. Hoping for good things to come.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056372299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1493500021}
review:
It's like a tabletop wizards of the coast game with miniatures, meets heroes of might and magic.
For those looking for a quick review, it's a good game. It has a lot of fixes still as to be expected with an early access game, but if you're looking for a different kind of RPG then give it a go.

Pros:
Unique style of gameplay - Offers a more casual, different approach on the typical RPG.
Crafting - A crafting system. It has one.
Combat - A heroes of might and magic take on combat.
Developers - Active devs that listen to the community.
Party System - A very simple and fantastic party system. 
Base of Operations - Like player housing. Your central HUB. 
Soundtrack - Nice ambient music. Not sure how limited the soundtrack is though.
Character Customization - Not bad, It's not fantastic but it was a lot more than what I was expecting.

Cons:
Difficult to understandat first. I feel the overwhealming "what do I do?" at the start of the game could deter players from giving it a good try. There should be a tutorial or at least more detailed, thurough help pages.
Some bugs/fixes that need to be addressed. 
Crafting - It's crafting system is somewhat limited and difficult to understand. There are 4 "professions" and some gathering tools. I hope they can expand to give some more options later on. 
Party Base - I feel there should be a party option where multiple players can enter a single BOO within a party and interact with it. 
 

I gave this a positive review because I think the game is on the right track. I wouldn't say it's ready to be played at it's full potential just yet. For the quality of the game and considering it's early access right now I'd say it's price is a bit steep. If you compare it to game quality of other games and such I feel this game should be priced between 10-13$ CDN, instead of 17$.

author: {'steamid': '76561198341933057', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1508301517}
review:
Stash is a very intriguing game, It has aspects that I find both familiar and foreign, as well as downright awesome, but also odd and possibly annoying. I enjoy the fact that it's turn-based as well as click to move with the game itself plotting a path to where you want to go. Negative: sometimes the paths take you through locations that prompt you whether you want to enter or not. I find that a little annoying. I wish the pathing would take you around the location and/or not trigger the prompt unless I had specifically clicked on it. 

I really enjoy combat. It has a really old-school video game feel to it. I played a game a long time ago on a Sega Genesis that was similar. Grid areas, turn based, etc. There is also a very noticeable difference in combat between the classes offered and how you have to approach encounters. I like that a lot. 4 classes and every one of them is genuinely different.

Overall I like the game. I really enjoy the company as well. Frogdice games are something I have been playing for ~20 years. They have a tendency towards "subtle depth" in their games. They don't beat you over the head with the lore. They let you uncover it - and I have a distinct feeling that same approach is included in this game as well. 

I would recommend this game to anyone that enjoys spending hours and hours at their computers. It would be great for people who are looking something to do in the background that they can walk away from without worry that they're losing something. 

The community also seems very helpful. Any questions I've had has been answered rather quickly. Something not always found in a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030802602', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3037, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1303, 'last_played': 1599128719}
review:
Это действительно пока early access, очень мало всего доступно, но тем не менее игра вполне себе радует. Сейчас вобще не так много пошаговых ммо такого типа - только WakFu\Dofus на ум приходит. На данный момент все развитие персонажа идет через гринд мобов, но так везде) Очень радует коммьюнити, а особенно разработчики - они почти постоянно в игре, отвечают на вопросы, а мне даже помогли немного с итемами на крафт. 
Расстраивает онлайн - больше трех человек онлайн пока не видел, в том числе в общем чате. Но в игру такого типа можно вполне себе играть и соло до какого-то момента, а это к тому же EA пока..
Вобщем рекомендую всем любителям первых двух Fallout , но, возможно, после выхода игры из EA - пока что игра исключительно про соло-фарм мобов.

author: {'steamid': '76561198341533806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 974, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1478982208}
review: Very fun game, I highly recommend it for the gamer who likes a challenge.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025344951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2726, 'last_played': 1559434676}
review:
This game is early access, and since I have been playing there have been many improvements already made.  The devs listen to the players, ask for input and are interested in our thoughts, and I love that.  So far, I have 46.5 (wow...it felt like less) hours in this game and I really do enjoy playing it.  There is already so much to do, and the community has been wonderful.  Stash is good for solo play, as well as in dungeon parties and I like that because while I am not always feeling social, I still want to play games.  This is a turn based game.  At first it seems easy, but as you advance, you really have to plan your positions and your skills to achieve victory.  The crafting is challenging, but failures are not a complete waste.  You can use your failures to your advantage later on.  As a Sim's fan, I also have to say that I really like the customization for the BOO(Base of Operations).  Each player as the ability to create their dream house.  

I am looking forward to seeing this game develop even further as time goes on.  I recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561197973354127', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1478193506}
review: I'm not sure if I could name anything I did not like about this game. It's easy to pick up, very colourful and the combat is pretty easy to get the hang of. I definately recommend this game and cannot wait until it is fully released! 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197964259659', 'num_games_owned': 712, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 205820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117509, 'last_played': 1564204854}
review:
A game designed by gamers who are devoted to their craft. This game has so many great things going for it and it's still in Beta!

The Devs and community are easily the best part of this game. They genuinely care about their players and community and go above and beyond with the amount of time they actually spend interacting with them. Every player has a voice when it comes to content or improvements in the game and can post them freely on the Frogdice forums or discuss with the devs using the in-game chat. Updates are pushed out weekly and most offer new content, bug fixes, and new systems as requested by players. The devs also change what content is prioritized by community suggestions and requests. This just adds to the awesome gameplay and content by giving each player direct access to those in control. No other game I have every played has gone this far in terms of customer service and attention to their community.

The game itself is bright and colorful and has delightfully inspired creatures that invoke a sense of nostalgia for older RPG's while still bringing a new and fun approach to the genre. The tile based combat system is a nice touch that offers lots of tactical options and a fun way to play with other players.

The crafting system still needs some work but what is already in place is a great system that is easy to get lost in and spend time crafting out gear for yourself and friends. The newspaper system for buying and selling is easy to use once you get a few upgrades out of the way and offers pletty of options for getting what you need to advance your craft.

All in all the game has a great learning curve and will keep you coming back for more. As the content gets pushed out by the Devs it will only get better and better.


edit: 2000+ hours and I still love this game.  I still haven't played through all the content and there is still lots to do.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972929715', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1505227400}
review:
I'm happy to be changing my thumbs down to a thumbs up.  Much has changed since I last played in EA and I have to say, a lot has improved.  Almost all my problem points have been addressed and this game is actually pretty darn fun now.

It's good to see the population is booming also.  Game seems to be doing well with a very active and helpful community.  Only major issue right now is server lag, but that could be because of the population boom.

Anyway try it out, it's free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000283168', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1019, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 801, 'last_played': 1478455979}
review: Got this game last night, and oh my gosh, is this a fun game with awesome concepts. Upgrading your house is addicting. You can also build/upgrade your stall at your house, which you can sell items from as your own vendor station. The devs were playing with me all night, answering all the questions I have. Great crafting, awesome procedural dungeons, and good mechanics. All microtransactions bought in early access will be refunded on release, and there is only ONE wipe, and that is on actual release.

author: {'steamid': '76561198337945884', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1476929799}
review: Great game!  Excited to delve in more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198278955021', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1476882393}
review: Really enjoyed playing the Stash early release. The potential for this game to grow and be even more awesome is certainly there, I really enjoy the gaming community. I like having a "BOO" and I think that the name is cute. Not sure how I feel about the boardgame "space" movement type in the open world, but I think it will grow on me because it is different than the RPG open world format that every other game has. I like having my character on a pedestal as a throwback to table top RPQ roots, (another reason I think the movement mechanism will grow on me). All in all a very fun expirience and I can't wait to play more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146457509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1490410586}
review:
Thoroughly enjoyed the game to this point. Ready to see what else is out there!

The community is great, which is a welcome change to most games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030877117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1476816581}
review: The good idea, but it is really raw version of the game. Has a lot of glitches and awful performance for such simple 3D graphics. User interface is not intuitive really hard to understand how to use your stuff. More a lot of work should be done to this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999986382', 'num_games_owned': 561, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 218257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5108, 'last_played': 1554510373}
review:
If you are looking for a great community to invest your playing hours with, you'll find it with Stash.  While it's currently EA, there is still quite a bit to do (with more being added constantly).  Join the early access to help shape the features and lore of the final game!  

The developers nearly always have a presence online and respond enthusiastically to suggestions.  Questions are normally answered quickly by either the developers themselves, or by the many friendly players.  I would encourge you to play, reach out to the community online and help build the game that you want to play. 
 
Based on the developers track record I fully expect this game to keep growing for the next decade (or longer).

author: {'steamid': '76561198338276809', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 77499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2712, 'last_played': 1519762470}
review:
I've been following this game for a while and was excited when it finally launched. It has already exceeded my expectations and it seems like every few days it gets even better. The devs are very active in the community and have done a great job communicating with the players.

I love the unique design ideas and the fact that they are really forging their own path in the MMO space. Turn based combat is so much fun and the BOO (player house) is far more expansive than I expected.

Keep up the great work, Frogdice!

author: {'steamid': '76561198337948975', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 18397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 711, 'last_played': 1511293373}
review:
Such a great game! I have been dreaming of a game like this. I am a long time MMO player and have grown bored with the same old thing. This is really a breath of fresh air. 

I love the aesthetic so much. There is nothing else like this. The community is top notch. I think it is wonderful that right away I own a piece of the world with my house and land and get to flesh it out so much.

This is my new home.

author: {'steamid': '76561198335959024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 11444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5751, 'last_played': 1486608036}
review: Love this game! Stash combines turn-based combat with gathering, crafting and collecting in a fresh new way. Depending on what part of the game is most interesting to you, there are lots of different strategies you can take -- so the game stays fresh and exciting even after you've played it awhile. Plus, the artwork is awesome. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197972381235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1476487764}
review: I've always loved Frogdice and their games. STASH is a unique premise that I am sure they will deliver on. I am looking forward to being a part of its continued development.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970293934', 'num_games_owned': 755, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1475023929}
review:
Game has a lot of potential.  Still needs some work but still pretty fun! 

I am excited to see where it goes from here.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979708832', 'num_games_owned': 418, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1505186997}
review: A great idea for an online multiplayer game. Great strategy combat, actually requires teamwork and planning. Great community. Definitely worth checking out. Keep an eye on this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141357510', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 610, 'last_played': 1549242482}
review:
Super awesome game! Has a tabletop D&D charm to it. Combat is superb. Turn based goodness. So much planning and thought and it rewards smart play. 

My BOO/house is amaaaaaaaaaaazing. I can build so many rooms, add things to my yard, craft, this is almost a whole game into itself. 

Community is everything people here promised it to be. Super nice people. 

I am so happy to support this game's development and it is definitely my new home online.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006687525', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1475809402}
review:
Alright folks, gotten about an hour and a half into the Early Access of Stash. There are some rough spots as to be expected (Elementalist Tooltips some abilities display what the extra status effects do, and some do not, but I can see that they're adding those in as things get fleshed out). But for the most part, the FOUNDATION of this game is strong, it has a unique premise and a good framework for both solo and party play. Right now, at least with an Elementalist, some of the four creature encounters can get a bit overwhelming, but with a good understanding of turn based RPGs you can survive. I look forward to this game developing further, as I've seen good things from this developer in the past.

You would be wise to at least keep an eye on Stash, if not pick it up on Early Access.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033729268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1475492946}
review:
For an early access build, Stash is remarkably stable, what few issues do exist are patched very quickly by one of the most approachable and communicative development teams I’ve seen of late. I’m sure we’re all familiar with the trend of releasing a buggy mess into early access, grabbing quick cash from release hype and then disappearing into the ether. I’m happy to say Frogdice has not followed this trend with Stash. This is clearly a labour of love for the developers, and I look forward to seeing it evolve through Early Access and to completed release.

That being said, I would be remiss if I didn’t point out that for an early access game with a price point, the game does feel a little bare. Whilst I can understand that the developers do want to focus on core mechanics before adding the artistic flair, it is a factor which is keeping me from playing this game more often. I do recommend it for people who enjoy getting in on the ground level of a game’s development, and I honestly do believe it will be a feature amongst RPG aficionados ‘Must own’ recommendations come final release.

author: {'steamid': '76561198475338882', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 29592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16098, 'last_played': 1515395944}
review:
Such a cool game! It has such an inviting feel and I just feel warm and fuzzy while playing it. I am following the Getting Started guide in game and that really has guided me through what to do to learn the basics. I can already see there is a lot of depth to the game and it will take quite a long time to master. I love that!

So many reviews have mentioned the great community and I have to add to that. Friendly people and very active developers really make for a top notch experience in game. I can tell the devs really care about the community and want to make sure it stays excellent.

I highly recommend this game and am glad I am on the ground floor so I can help contribute ideas and how the game progresses.

author: {'steamid': '76561198334913951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 78236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 824, 'last_played': 1509603588}
review:
This game is a breath of fresh air. I have played so many MMOs and they all seem like variations on the same thing. Stash is really unique and brings some cool new ideas. 

Turn based combat is what jumps right out. You have time to plan and think and I really like that. 

Your house (called your BOO or base of operations) is quite impressive. I can already see that this feature is incredibly deep and I will put a lot of time into making my BOO killer. 

A number of people have mentioned the community and I thought that was bs but then I got in game and they were right. The people in game are great and the devs are very open and honest and clearly care about this game a lot.

It is indeed early access so nothing is perfect but i can tell the rough edges will get dealt with and this is already a lot of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198334040345', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 40361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1519246714}
review:
Really dig this game. It is such a refreshing take on MMOs. The turn based combat really rewards planning and thinking. The style of the game totally reminds me of my old college DnD group. Community is already fantastic and super helpful. People are always talking to each other and helping out. 

Early Access has pros and cons. The con is things aren't totally finished and you have to experiment and go through more trial an error to figure out what to do. I get that and I can already see the devs working their butts off to improve all that rapidly.

The big pro is I like that my feedback has a bit impact already and I get to be part of a growing community.

People thinking about buying this should keep in mind that this is not full release. It will be harder to figure out what to do right away, and if you dont like that then hold off for a bit. But if you want to be part of what I think is going to be a real game changer in the mmo genre, then jump in!

author: {'steamid': '76561198154767028', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1475420871}
review:
Honestly can't recommend this, if you're interested you're better off playing something like Dofus or Wakfu.  

The game works well and isn't buggy, but whats there just isn't particularly interesting, and the game doesn't explain itself very well at all, though that could be excused given that It's in early access.

This game has a long way to go and is not worth a purchase in It's current state.

I also really dont get the decision to keep the grid based movement in the overworld, it feels clunky and out of place, free movement on the world map would be much nicer.

I'll revisit the game a couple of months from now and see if this review should be changed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004162543', 'num_games_owned': 329, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1475700912}
review:
Ну нахуя я купил это говно? Это не игра - это курсовая работа студента сантехника 1 курса.
Номинация - шлак года.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996712777', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 621, 'last_played': 1528335391}
review:
Review to be found here!

http://steamcommunity.com/app/466660/discussions/0/343787920125774832/

author: {'steamid': '76561197972654836', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1475243012}
review: As some others have said, this game is in early access and content is still being added (and bugs fixed as found).  But I can recommend this game to other players if they go into it with that understanding and mindset.  I have been finding the game very enjoyable.  It has the mechanics and advantages of an MMO, but has an tabletop RPG feel to it that I don't find in the big MMOs nowadays.   If you ever played MUDs, then this is certainly a game for you.  Even if you haven't, but are looking for something that gives you more of the community feels you get from a tabletop group, then this game is for you too!

author: {'steamid': '76561198043731689', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1511061730}
review: Backed the game on Kickstarter and have been following it through development. There's a TON of content in there, but you might not see it all, as the game is very much non-linear. Get in there and start exploring!

author: {'steamid': '76561198003865920', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1475205197}
review:
I just started playing the game and I've been following it for a while. Backed it on Kickstarter and looked forward to teh game coming out on steam for early access. So far the game feels good. I'm having fun and only level 2 for now, almost 3. I have a forge and can craft weapons. There is a strong sense of what items you want to keep when looting. 

The community is extremely nice and engaging people which is nice.

I'm looking forward to more dungeons, more loot and making my Base of Operations grow. 

Come join, my name is Redderick, I'll be crafting weapons.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133529527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1503966330}
review: I was a Kickstarter backer for this and must admit it was worth the wait. This game combines turn-by-turn gameplay with role-playing. It's like an old school tabletop RPG meets online strategy game. I'll write something more lengthy once I've played the game a little longer. But so far, I'm really enjoying it :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198007380807', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 757, 'last_played': 1499034464}
review: Saw this game at PAX East 2016 and instantly fell in love with it. To be aprt of this game from such an early phase makes me happy to see it come to life on Steam. Great game and fun to play whether you only ahve a fwe minutes or a fwe hours! Highly recomend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198184425866', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1475185764}
review: This is in early access at the moment but is everything I wanted in this game. It's a no pressure, friendly, and casual turn based tactical combat RPG. Has lots of features currently (like crafting) and you build your own house (called a BOO)! The best part is you can help development create the future of stash by getting involved now! 5 / 5 would recommend again!

author: {'steamid': '76561198156068059', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1511134388}
review:
This is a delightful and very deep game. Combat is engaging and requires planning and strategy. Character development options are already numerous and I can tell things will be branching out more as I keep playing. The art style is very reminiscent of tabletop gaming with your friends. 

The game is not easy but not punishing. You have to make decisions and choices, and there are clearly a lot of things to earn. Levels, stats, and gear are the obvious mmo type stuff, but building up your house, your storage space, your personal carrying capacity, and many other things show me that I have a lot of ways to improve myself. I really like that. 

So far the people in game have been really nice as well. The devs are active and seem to really want to make this a great game.

I look forward to how Stash develops.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009124664', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1504984101}
review:
I have had the opportunity to put some time into the game and I intend to put more in.  I was not sure what I would think about it at first, there were some concepts that I was not sure I would like (such as the token aspect representing the character on the world map).  But I have actually found that I really like the feel, to me at least, of playing an interactive board game on the PC.

The game is intuitive, addictive, and to me the most important quality is enjoyment.  I can play it at home or at my office and I still get a great return on my time.  I would recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054975219', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1624, 'last_played': 1508870224}
review:
Like many early access games I've jumped in on, Stash has it's share of bugs and various features that need to be optomized, things you should typically expect if you start playing a game in early access during development.  Something you don't expect or see very often is how involved the devs are with their community, playing along side you, finding and going over bugs and discussing with you, in game, how certain mechanics can be changed for the better.  I've been playing a few days now and there have already been several patches to fix issues and make balancing changes, all based on the feedback and bugs found by the community since early release started.

The game itself I find enjoyable and relaxing, my first impression left me thinking about my old days of playing D&D with friends.  There was no form of tutorial or help page when I started playing, but within a day or so a help button was added with a little getting started guide and tips.  There is usually someone around who can help answer specific questions as well.  I now spend most of my time running solo and just chatting with everyone.  Now and then I'll join a party or pair up with someone to clear a dungeon or two.  When my bags are full, I stop by my Base of Operations (BOO) to offload my loot, upgrade my stuff and even do a little cooking when I have the materials.  Then off to town to sell the extra loot to vendors.

I find myself being drawn back into game whenever I have free time, both to keep hunting for loot to upgrade my base and skills, and for the connection to the community.  I see the game become better every day as bugs are squashed and new elements are added and/or rebalanced.  Hopefully I'll see more of you in the game with us soon, helping to make this game everything it has the potential to be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008593454', 'num_games_owned': 1344, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 936, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1510392775}
review:
Интересная задумка, много обещает, но на данной стадии [B]очень[/B] бета.

В остальном cложно сказать что-то конкретное. Дропа много, слотов мало, мобы простые, боевая система удобная, сообщество дружелюбное.

Если не можете терпеть отсутствие опций, присутствие багов и необходимость спрашивать других игроков - даже не пробуйте.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006677489', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1506592816}
review:
I've been following this game for a couple years now and have been excited to play this again and am happy to see they've reached Early Access Status with it.  As other's have mentioned this is still in Beta form, there's bugs, no tutorials and over all lacking polish you'd find in a finished game.

That being said the Devs are awesome and on the ball with any and all questions or problems you may run into.  There's a good wiki page set up for the game that answers most questions I've come across so far and the in game community is very friendly and helpful.

If you're a fan of Frogdice's other games and like their look and feel then you'll be right at home with Stash.

There's a learning curve, and like I said this isn't finished yet so just think about that before pulling the trigger and purchasing the game.

I'm having fun with it and can't wait to see where this game ends up after they are done with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039978725', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1504266315}
review: Ignore the 1 negative review above, he obviously cant read a wiki that clearly states how to start, anyway onto the review, its early access i will say that right out of the gates there are a few issues but nothing that prevents a fun experience. If you are looking for wow 2 then forget it, however if you are looking for something different, fun and quite refreshing then dive in, i was sceptical when i first logged in but after 10 mins of learning my way around and speaking to the nice community i am starting to love this game, the devs are active in game and the concept is great. For a £10 game its worth every single penny, would recommend +++++

author: {'steamid': '76561198076070773', 'num_games_owned': 401, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 9293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3599, 'last_played': 1641803735}
review:
Original
As of now I have no real opinion on the game.   It feels as it should for a early beta.   Game Developers are pretty on the ball with anything we report.    Only warning I'd give is this is not a finished product, don't purcahse it expecting it to be one you would be dissapointed.     The community is A+ though.


New:
In my 20 years of playing online games starting with MUD's I've never encountered a development team so passionate, so devoted, or so open to communication.     This team work constantly to deliver with constant updates and a real at home enviroment.     I feel like part of the family and development process.    The game itself is still a little shakey but every bug encountered is quickly squished at this rate I have no doubt in my mind that this game will be one of my top ten favorites once it is complete.     I even decided to drop a extra $50 just to show support.    Which I rarely do.     Please do keep in mind my old review though if you decide to purchase into this beta.   It is a development and testing phase so things are constantly changing and bugs happen.   Patience is needed, but for those who stick with it, they gain a new family. a new home.   I think anyone who enjoys a D&D style of game, or MUD would get the most value out of this game.    I personally get a mouthful of nostalgic member berries everytime I log in.
